ref: NASA's shuttle program chief N. Wayne Hale Jr. said the foam had fallen "after the time we are concerned about."

src: 表演剛開演五分鐘就突然捲起一陣狂風，大約一分鐘後風速就已高達每小時 70 公里…然後暴雨襲來，雨勢又急又大，打在皮膚上有如針刺，緊接著冰雹從天而降，人們驚惶尖叫，奔跑互踩。
mt: The performance was just five minutes after the performance, a sudden gust of wind suddenly swept up, and about one minute later, the wind speed had reached 70 kilometers per hour... Then heavy rain came, the rain was extremely fast and heavy, hitting the skin like needles, followed by hail falling from the sky, people were panicked and screamed, running on each other.
ref: Five minutes into the display a wind starts rolling in, about a minute later, the wind is reaching 70km/h... then the rain comes, but so hard and so large that it slaps your skin like a needle, then hail fell from the sky, people panicking and screaming and running over each other.

src: 我失去了我的姊妹和她的朋友，而我在逃跑途中，有兩名坐輪椅的身障人士，大家直接跳過他們和推擠他們。」阿曼．維薩切 (Armand Versace) 說。
mt: I lost my sister and her friend, and I was on my way to escape with two wheelchair-bound people, who jumped over them and pushed them,” said Armand Versace.
ref: I lost my sister and her friend, and on my way there were two disabled people in wheelchairs, people just jumping over and pushing them," Armand Versace said.

src: NHK 也報導，位於新潟縣的柏崎刈羽核能發電廠當時運作正常。
mt: NHK also reported that the Kashiwazaki Toba Nuclear Power Plant in Niigata Prefecture was operating normally at the time.
ref: NHK also reported that the Kashiwazaki Kariwa nuclear power plant in Niigata prefecture was operating normally.

src: 北陸電力回報未受地震影響，且志賀核能發電廠的一號和二號反應爐也關閉了。
mt: Hokuriku Electric reported that it was not affected by the earthquake, and the No. 1 and No. 2 reactors of Shiga Nuclear Power Plant were also closed.
ref: Hokuriku Electric Power Co. reported no effects from the earthquake and that the Number 1 and 2 reactors at its Shika nuclear power plant were shut down.

src: 根據報導，在此地區約有 9400 戶民宅斷水，100 戶民宅斷電。
mt: According to reports, about 9,400 households in this area have been without water and 100 households have been without electricity.
ref: It is reported that some 9400 homes in the region are without water and approximately 100 without electricity.

src: 部分道路已受損，受災地區的鐵路服務中斷，而石川縣的能登機場依舊關閉。
mt: Some roads have been damaged, railway services have been suspended in the affected area, and Noto Airport in Ishikawa Prefecture is still closed.
ref: Some roads have been damaged, railway service interrupted in the affected areas, and the Noto Airport in Ishikawa prefecture remains closed.

src: 一顆炸彈在當地行政長官的辦公室外爆炸。
mt: A bomb exploded outside the local Chief Executive's office.
ref: One bomb exploded outside the governor general's office.

src: 兩小時內有另外三顆炸彈在政府大樓附近爆炸。
mt: Three more bombs exploded near the government building within two hours.
ref: Three more bombs exploded near government buildings in a period of two hours.

src: 部分報導的官方死亡人數是八人，官方報導則證實多達 30 人受傷；但真正的人數仍不得而知。
mt: The official death toll from some reports is eight, while the official report confirms that as many as 30 people have been injured; however, the actual number remains unknown.
ref: Some reports put the official death toll at eight, and official reports confirm that up to 30 were injured; but final numbers are not yet known.

src: 食用受污染的寵物食品後死亡的寵物，在牠們的尿液樣本中都發現了三聚氰酸和三聚氰胺。
mt: Pets who died after eating contaminated pet food have been found to have cyanide and melamine in their urine samples.
ref: Both cyanuric acid and melamine were found in urine samples from pets that died after consuming contaminated pet food.

src: 貴湖大學的研究員表示，兩種化合物會互相反應，產生阻礙腎功能的結晶。
mt: Researchers at Guihu University say that the two compounds react to each other, producing crystals that hinder kidney function.
ref: The two compounds react with one another to form crystals that may block kidney function, researchers at the university said.

src: 研究人員在貓尿中加入三聚氰胺和三聚氰酸，並觀察其中形成的結晶。
mt: Researchers add melamine and melamine to cat urine, observing the crystal formation within it.
ref: The researchers observed crystals formed in cat urine by the addition of melamine and cyanuric acid.

src: 透過紅外光譜術 (FTIR) 進行比較時顯示，這些晶體的組成與受害寵物的尿液中發現的晶體相符。
mt: When compared through infrared spectroscopy (FTIR), it is shown that the composition of these crystals matches the crystal found in the urine of the victim pet.
ref: The composition of these crystals matches those found in the urine of affected pets when compared by infrared spectroscopy (FTIR).

src: 我不知道你是否認知到這點，但中美洲的商品多是以免稅的待遇進入這個國家。
mt: I don't know if you're aware of this, but most of the goods in Central America have entered this country with tax-free treatment.
ref: I don't know if you realize it or not, but most of the goods from Central America came into this country duty-free.

src: 但我們有 80% 的商品被中美洲國家徵稅。我們對待你。
mt: But 80% of our goods are taxed by Central American countries.
ref: Yet eighty percent of our goods were taxed through tariffs in Central American countries. we treat you.

src: 對我來說這似乎不合理；這肯定不公平。
mt: It doesn't seem right to me; it certainly isn't fair.
ref: That didn't seem to make sense to me; it certainly wasn't fair.

src: 我對別人只會說，我們怎樣對待你，你便要怎樣對待我們。
mt: I only say to others, how we treat you, how you will treat us.
ref: All I say to people is you treat us the way we treat you.

src: 加州州長阿諾‧史瓦辛格簽署一項法案，禁止販賣暴力電動遊戲給未成年。
mt: California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed a bill banning the sale of violent video games to minors.
ref: California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed into law a bill that bans the sale or rental of violent video games to minors.

src: 該法案要求在加州銷售的暴力電子遊戲須貼上帶有數字「18」的貼紙，並規定銷售給未成年人每次可被處以 1,000 美元的罰款。
mt: The bill requires that violent video games sold in California be labeled with a number "18" and stipulates that those sold to minors can be fined $1,000 each time.
ref: The bill requires violent video games sold in the state of California to be labeled with a decal reading "18" and makes their sale to a minor punishable by a fine of $1000 per offense.

src: 檢察長基爾‧斯塔摩今早發表聲明，宣布起訴休恩和普萊斯。
mt: Prosecutor Kiel Stamos issued a statement this morning announcing the prosecution of Huene and Price.
ref: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Kier Starmer QC, gave a statement this morning announcing the prosecution of both Huhne and Pryce.

src: 休恩已辭職，他在內閣的職位將由愛德·戴維議員接任。諾曼·蘭姆議員有望接替戴維，出任商務大臣一職。
mt: He has resigned and will be succeeded by Congressman Ed David in the Cabinet. Norman Lamb is expected to succeed David as Secretary of State for Commerce.
ref: Huhne has resigned and he will be replaced in the Cabinet by Ed Davey MP. Norman Lamb MP is expected to take the Business Minister job Davey is vacating.

src: 休恩和普賴斯定於 2 月 16 日在威斯敏斯特裁判法院出庭。
mt: Höhn and Price will appear at the Westminster Magistrates' Courts on February 16.
ref: Huhne and Pryce are scheduled to appear at the Westminster Magistrates Court on February 16.

src: 死者為 25 歲的尼可拉斯．阿爾登 (Nicholas Alden) 和 21 歲的札克利．庫德巴克 Zachary Cuddeback 。庫德巴克是巴士的駕駛。
mt: The dead were Nicholas Alden, 25, and Zachary Cuddeback, 21, who drove the bus.
ref: The fatalities were Nicholas Alden, 25, and Zachary Cuddeback, 21. Cuddeback had been the driver.

src: 埃德加·維古拉 (Edgar Veguilla) 的手臂和下顎受傷，而克里斯托弗·施耐德 (Kristoffer Schneider) 則需要進行臉部重建手術。
mt: Edgar Veguilla's arm and lower jaw were injured, while Kristoffer Schneider required facial reconstruction surgery.
ref: Edgar Veguilla received arm and jaw wounds while Kristoffer Schneider was left requiring reconstructive surgery for his face.

src: 烏卡瞄準第五個人的頭部時槍枝失靈。史耐德受傷造成長久性的疼痛、一隻眼睛失明、顱骨缺損，臉部必須以鈦金屬重建。
mt: When Uka aimed at the fifth person's head, the gun failed. Snell's injury caused long-lasting pain, one eye blindness, a skull missing, and the face had to be reconstructed with titanium.
ref: Uka's weapon failed whilst pointed at a fifth man's head. Schneider has ongoing pain, blindness in one eye, a missing section of skull and a face rebuilt from titanium.

src: 施耐德在家鄉的一處美國空軍基地視訊作證。
mt: Schneider testified via video at a U.S. airbase in his hometown.
ref: Schneider testified via videolink from a USAF base in his homeland.

src: 除了周三的比賽，卡潘內多 (Carpanedo) 也參加了錦標賽中的兩場個別賽事。
mt: In addition to Wednesday's competition, Carpanedo also participated in two individual events of the championship.
ref: Beyond Wednesday's event, Carpanedo competed in two individual races at the Championships.

src: 她的第一場比賽是小迴轉賽，第一回合以未完賽收場。該場比賽的 116 名選手中，有 36 名取得了相同的成績。
mt: Her first race was a small turnaround, with the first round ending in an unfinished series. Of the 116 players in the game, 36 had the same result.
ref: Her first was the Slalom, where she earned a Did Not Finish in her first run. 36 of the 116 competitors had the same result in that race.

src: 她的另一場比賽是大迴轉賽，她以 4 分 41 秒 30 的綜合時間名列坐式滑雪女子組第 10 名，比名列第 1 的奧地利選手克勞迪亞．洛許 (Claudia Loesch) 慢了 2 分 11 秒 60，比名列第 9 的匈牙利選手潔爾吉．丹尼 (Gyöngyi Dani) 慢了 1 分 09 秒 02。
mt: Her other race was the Grand Reversal, where she finished 10th in the women's sitting skiing category with a combined time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 behind Austrian athlete Claudia Loesch, and 1:09.02 behind Hungarian athlete Gyöngyi Dani, who ranked 9th.
ref: Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher Gyöngyi Dani of Hungary.

src: 女子坐式團體中有四位滑雪者未能完成比賽，在大迴轉賽的 117 位滑雪者中，有 45 位未在比賽中獲得排名。
mt: Among the women's sitting groups, four skiers failed to complete the competition, with 45 out of the 117 skiers in the Great Rotation, failing to rank in the competition.
ref: Four skiers in the women's sitting group failed to finish their runs, and 45 of the 117 total skiers in the Giant Slalom failed to rank in the race.

src: 中央邦警方找回了失竊的筆記型電腦和手機。
mt: The Central Police Department recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone.
ref: The Madhya Pradesh Police recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone.

src: 副督察長 D K 阿爾雅說：「我們已逮捕五名強暴那名瑞士女人的嫌犯，並取回她的手機和筆記型電腦」。
mt: Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said: "We have arrested five suspects for raping the Swiss woman and retrieved her mobile phone and laptop."
ref: Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said, "We have arrested five persons who raped the Swiss woman and recovered her mobile and laptop".

src: 被告的姓名為巴巴·康戛爾、布薩·康戛爾、藍普洛·康戛爾、迦札·康戛爾和維斯努·康戛爾。
mt: The names of the defendants were Baba Kangal, Busa Kangal, Blueplow Kangal, Ghazard Kangal and Visnu Kangal.
ref: The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar.

src: 警官錢德拉·謝哈爾·索蘭基說被告蒙面出庭。
mt: Police officer Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the defendant was shown in court.
ref: Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces.

src: 雖然車輛撞到房屋時有三人正在屋內，但無人受傷。
mt: Although a car crashed into a house, three people were inside, but no one was injured.
ref: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt.

src: 然而，那名司機的頭部受到了嚴重的傷害。
mt: However, the driver's head was severely injured.
ref: However, the driver sustained serious injuries to the head.

src: 緊急救難人員將駕駛員從紅色奧迪 TT 中救出來時，發生車禍的路段暫時封閉。
mt: Emergency rescue personnel rescued the driver from Red Audi TT when the road section of the car accident was temporarily closed.
ref: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT.

src: 一開始，他被收治到大雅茅斯 (Great Yarmouth) 的詹姆斯·佩吉特醫院 (James Paget Hospital)。
mt: Initially, he was admitted to James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
ref: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.

src: 後來，他被轉往劍橋的阿登布魯克醫院 (Addenbrooke's Hospital) 。
mt: Later, he was transferred to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
ref: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.

src: Adekoya（阿代科亞） 隨後在愛丁堡郡法院被控謀殺她的兒子。
mt: Adekoya was later charged with the murder of her son in Edinburgh County Court.
ref: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.

src: 她正被拘留中，等候起訴和審判，但由於她的影像已被廣泛發布，任何目擊者的證詞都可能受到汙染。
mt: She is being detained, waiting for prosecution and trial, but since her images have been widely released, any eyewitness testimony may be contaminated.
ref: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.

src: 這是英國其他地區的普遍做法，不過蘇格蘭司法的運作方式卻有所不同，法院認為發布照片會造成潛在的偏見。
mt: This is a common practice in other parts of the UK, but the judicial system in Scotland operates differently, with the court ruling that posting photos will lead to potential bias.
ref: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.

src: 丹地大學的帕梅拉‧弗格森教授指出：「如果發布嫌疑人的照片等資料，記者確實顯得遊走在險路上。」
mt: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dandy said, "If you publish a suspect's photo and other information, journalists do appear to be walking on a dangerous path."
ref: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."

src: 負責整體檢察事宜的蘇格蘭皇家檢察院向記者表示，至少在起訴前，將不再做出任何評論。
mt: The Scottish Royal Procuratorate, responsible for overall prosecutorial matters, told reporters that at least no comments will be made before the prosecution.
ref: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.

src: 根據洩漏的文件，該文件將提及巴勒斯坦希望以 1967 年中東戰爭之前的邊界為基礎這樁邊界糾紛。
mt: According to the leaked documents, the document will mention that Palestine hopes to base this border dispute on the borders before the 1967 Middle East War.
ref: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.

src: 據稱文件中的其他主題包括兩國共同聖城耶路撒冷的未來走向，以及約旦河谷問題。
mt: It is claimed that other topics in the documents include the future direction of Jerusalem, a shared holy city between the two countries, as well as the Jordan Valley problem.
ref: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.

src: 以色列要求，若簽署協議，將繼續在約旦河谷駐軍十年，而巴勒斯坦自治政府則同意駐軍只保留五年。
mt: Israel demands that if an agreement is signed, it will continue to be stationed in the Jordan Valley for ten years, while the Palestinian Authority agrees to keep the troops there for only five years.
ref: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.

src: 參與有害動物控制補強試驗的狩獵者會受到國家公園管理員之緊密監督，因相關單位需要監控並評估此試驗的績效。
mt: Hunters participating in the hazardous animal control reinforcement test will be closely supervised by national park administrators, as relevant units need to monitor and evaluate the performance of this test.
ref: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.

src: 新州國家公園管理局 (NPWS) 與澳洲射擊運動協會 (NSW) 合作，在射擊運動協會的狩獵計畫下招攬了符合資格的志工。
mt: The New State National Park Service (NPWS) and the Australian Shooting Sport Association (NSW) have partnered to recruit eligible volunteers for the Shooting Sport Association's hunting program.
ref: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.

src: 根據新州國家公園及野生動物服務部公園保育與遺產單位的代理總監密克‧歐福林表示，獲選進行第一場射擊的 4 位射擊手已接受周全的安全及訓練指導。
mt: According to Mick O'Flynn, Acting Director of Conservation and Heritage Unit of the New State National Parks and Wildlife Service, the four shooters selected for the first shot have received comprehensive safety and training guidance.
ref: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.

src: 馬德立昨日在由九名委員組成的臨時選舉委員會 (CEP) 中宣誓。
mt: Madley was sworn in yesterday at the CEP, a nine-member temporary election committee.
ref: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.

src: 這是馬德立四年內的第五個臨時選舉委員會。
mt: This is the fifth temporary election committee of Madri during his four years.
ref: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.

src: 作為推動國家邁向新選舉之成套措施的一環，總統委員會在上個月建議前任臨時選舉委員會辭職。
mt: As part of a set of measures to drive the country towards new elections, the Presidential Committee recommended last month that the former Temporary Election Committee resign.
ref: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.

src: 該委員會是馬德立回應從十月開始的大規模反政權抗議活動而設立的。
mt: The committee was established in response to the large-scale anti-government protests that began in October.
ref: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.

src: 這些有時會使用暴力的抗議活動，起因是無法舉行選舉，有些選舉早在 2011 年就該舉行了。
mt: These sometimes use violent protest activities, the cause is that they cannot hold elections, some of which were held as early as 2011.
ref: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.

src: 據報約有 60 件 iPod 過熱的故障案例，總計造成 6 起火災，並導致 4 人輕度灼傷。
mt: According to reports, there were about 60 cases of iPod overheating, resulting in a total of six fires and causing four people to be lightly burned.
ref: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.

src: 日本經濟產業省 (METI) 表示，已獲悉 27 起事故與該裝置相關 。
mt: The Japanese Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) has reported 27 incidents related to the device.
ref: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.

src: 上週經濟產業省宣布 Apple 已向他們通報另外 34 起過熱事件，該公司宣稱這些事件「並不嚴重」。
mt: Last week, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry announced that Apple had reported 34 other overheating incidents to them, which the company claimed were "not serious."
ref: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."

src: 該政府部門回應，稱蘋果公司推遲報告一事「令人遺憾」。
mt: The government department responded, saying Apple's delay of reporting was "regrettable".
ref: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."

src: 該地震在當地時間 07:19 a.m. 襲擊馬里亞納（格林威治標準時間為星期五 09:19 p.m.）
mt: The earthquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 GMT on Friday)
ref: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).

src: 北馬里亞納群島緊急管理處表示，沒有收到國內的損傷回報。
mt: The Emergency Management Office of the Northern Mariana Islands stated that they have not received any domestic damage reports.
ref: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.

src: 太平洋海嘯警報中心也表示沒有海嘯跡象。
mt: The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center also indicates that there are no tsunami signs.
ref: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.

src: 一名前菲律賓員警在菲律賓的首都馬尼拉劫持香港觀光客的巴士，並把他們當作人質。
mt: A former Philippine police officer hijacked a Hong Kong tourist bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines, and took them hostage.
ref: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.

src: 羅蘭多‧蒙多薩以 M16 步槍向遊客射擊。
mt: Ronald Mondoza fired at visitors with his M16 rifle.
ref: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.

src: 目前已經救出幾名人質，並確認至少六人死亡。
mt: Several hostages have been rescued and at least six people have been confirmed dead.
ref: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.

src: 他們先釋放了包括小孩與老人在內的六名人質，如同菲律賓籍的攝影師那樣。
mt: They first released six hostages, including children and the elderly, like Filipino photographers.
ref: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.

src: 兩名攝影師後來與一名需要如廁的老婦人交換。最後曼多薩被擊斃。
mt: Two photographers later exchanged with an old woman who needed to go to the toilet. Mandoza was killed.
ref: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.

src: 利金斯追隨父親的腳步，進入醫學界。
mt: Liggins followed in his father's footsteps and entered the medical world.
ref: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.

src: 他接受訓練成為產科醫生，並於 1959 年開始在奧克蘭國立婦女醫院執業。
mt: He received training to become an obstetrician and began practicing at the National Women's Hospital in Auckland in 1959.
ref: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.

src: 利金斯 (Liggins) 爵士於醫院任職時，就會利用下班後的時間研究早產現象。
mt: During his time at the hospital, Sir Liggins would use his post-work hours to study the phenomenon of preterm birth.
ref: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.

src: 他的研究顯示，如果施打某種荷爾蒙，將加速胎兒肺部的成熟。
mt: His research shows that if a certain hormone is administered, it will accelerate the fetal lung's maturity.
ref: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.

src: 新華社報導，政府調查人員於週三找回了兩個「黑盒子」飛行記錄器。
mt: Xinhua News Agency reported that government investigators found two "black box" flight recorders on Wednesday.
ref: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.

src: 摔角選手們也向露娜致敬。
mt: The wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
ref: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.

src: 湯米·卓門曾說：「露娜是第一位極限女王。我的第一位經理。露娜在雙月之夜去世，非常特別，就像她本人一樣。堅強的女人。」
mt: Tommy Chomen once said, “Luna was the first Extreme Queen. My first manager. Luna died on Double Moon night, very special, just like herself. A strong woman.”
ref: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."

src: 知名摔角手「金粉」達斯汀·讓尼爾斯 (Dustin Runnels) 評論說：「盧納和我一樣怪異…或許甚至比我還要怪異…我愛她，並且會想念她……希望她去了一個更好的地方。」
mt: “Runner is as weird as I am... maybe even weirder than I am... I love her and miss her... I hope she’s going to a better place,” said Dustin Runnels, a famous wrestler.
ref: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."

src: 在 2010 年聯邦選舉之前投票的 1400 人中，反對澳洲成為共和國的人數，比 2008 年多了 8%。
mt: Of the 1,400 people who voted before the 2010 federal election, 8% opposed Australia becoming a republic, up from 2008.
ref: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.

src: 看守總理茱莉亞‧吉拉德在 2010 年聯邦選舉的競選活動期間宣稱，她認為澳洲應該在伊莉莎白二世女王任期卸任時成為共和國。
mt: Guarding Prime Minister Julia Gillard during the 2010 federal election campaign, she claimed that Australia should become a republic when Queen Elizabeth II served her term.
ref: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.

src: 民調中有 34 % 的人同意這個觀點，希望伊麗莎白二世女王成為澳洲的最後一位君主。
mt: A survey found that 34 percent of people agreed with this view, hoping Queen Elizabeth II would become Australia's last monarch.
ref: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.

src: 在民調的兩個極端結果中，29% 的受訪者認為澳洲應該盡快成為共和國，而 31%的人認為澳洲永遠不該成為共和國。
mt: In the two extreme results of the polls, 29% of respondents believed that Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31% thought that Australia should never be a republic.
ref: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.

src: 這位奧運金牌選手原本要參加大英國協運動會的 100 公尺和 200 公尺自由式比賽，以及三項游泳接力賽，但他的症狀卻讓人懷疑他的身體狀況。
mt: The Olympic gold medalist had originally planned to compete in the Commonwealth Games in the 100m and 200m freestyle events, as well as in the three swimming relay events, but his symptoms made people suspect his physical condition.
ref: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.

src: 他無法服用藥物來抑制疼痛，因為奧運會禁止使用那些藥物。
mt: He cannot take drugs to suppress pain, because the Olympics prohibit the use of those drugs.
ref: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.

src: 中央密蘇里大學數學家、電腦科學教授柯提斯庫柏，於 1 月 25 日發現目前已知的最大質數。
mt: On January 25, Professor Curtis Cooper of Computer Science and a mathematician from the University of Central Missouri discovered the largest known prime number.
ref: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.

src: 到了二月初，幾個人用不同的硬體和軟體驗證了這項發現，於是在星期二正式宣布。
mt: By early February, a few people had verified the discovery with different hardware and software, so they officially announced it on Tuesday.
ref: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.

src: 地球上的水可能是彗星帶來的，水中的有機物質則可以形成蛋白質並供應生命所需。
mt: Earth's water may be brought by comets, and organic matter in the water can form proteins and supply life needs.
ref: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.

src: 科學家希望瞭解星球形成的過程，尤其是地球，因為彗星在很久以前曾與地球相撞。
mt: Scientists hope to understand the process of star formation, especially Earth, because comets collided with Earth a long time ago.
ref: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.

src: 53 歲的古莫今年稍早上任為州長，上個月簽署了一項將同性婚姻合法化的法案。
mt: 53-year-old Gumo became governor this morning, and last month he signed a law legalizing same-sex marriage.
ref: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.

src: 他稱這些謠言為「政治的碎語和愚昧」。
mt: He called these rumors "political blatant and foolish".
ref: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".

src: 據猜測他將在 2016 年競選總統。
mt: He is expected to run for president in 2016.
ref: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.

src: NextGen 是一種美國聯邦航空總署宣稱可讓飛機縮短飛行路徑的系統，每年能夠節省上百萬加侖的燃料，並大幅削減碳排放。
mt: NextGen is a US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) system that claims to shorten flight paths, saving millions of gallons of fuel per year and drastically reducing carbon emissions.
ref: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.

src: 它使用基於衛星的技術，而基於地面雷達的舊技術，來讓空中交通管制員更精準地定位飛機，並為飛行員提供更準確的資訊。
mt: It uses satellite-based technology, based on old ground radar technology, to enable air traffic controllers to locate aircraft more accurately and provide pilots with more accurate information.
ref: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.

src: 沒有提供其他的交通方式、地上鐵將不會停靠溫布利，現場也無可用的停車場與停車轉乘規劃。
mt: There is no other mode of transportation provided, and the overground railway will not stop at Wembley, nor is there a parking lot and transfer plan available on site.
ref: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.

src: 由於擔心交通不便，比賽可能被迫在各隊支持者無法到場加油的情況下開打。
mt: Due to concerns of inconvenient transportation, the game may be forced to start with supporters from each team unable to come and cheer on.
ref: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.

src: 星期四刊登在《科學》期刊的一篇研究報導了厄瓜多的加拉巴哥群島正在形成鳥類新物種。
mt: A study published in the journal Science on Thursday reported that a new bird species is forming in the Galapagos Islands of Ecuador.
ref: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.

src: 儘管過去人們認為新物種的演化過程歷時更久，但來自美國普林斯頓大學與瑞士烏普薩拉大學的研究人員卻發現這個新物種在短短兩個世代內就演化出來了，其為當地特有種達爾文雀（Geospiza fortes）和外來的仙人掌雀（Geospiza fortes）的混種。
mt: Although people in the past believed that the evolutionary process of this new species lasted longer, researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Switzerland found that this new species had evolved within just two generations, a hybrid of the local endemic species Geospiza fortes and the alien cactus fortes.
ref: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.

src: 黃金能被打造成各種形狀。它能被軋成微小的形狀。
mt: Gold can be shaped into various shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
ref: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.

src: 金可被延展成細絲，再進行纏繞和編織。亦可搥打或捲成薄片。
mt: Gold can be extended into fine threads, then wrapped and woven. It can also be pounded or rolled into thin slices.
ref: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.

src: 它可以做得很薄，並黏在其他金屬上。由於可以做得很薄，有時也會用在一種名為「泥金裝飾手抄本」的書籍上，裝飾其中的手繪圖片。
mt: It can be made very thin and stuck to other metals. Because it can be made very thin, it is sometimes used in a book called "Mud Gold Decorative Codex" to decorate the hand-drawn pieces.
ref: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".

src: 這稱為化學的酸鹼度。您可以用紫甘藍汁來作為指示劑。
mt: This is called the pH of chemistry. You can use purple glycerin juice as an indicator.
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.

src: 甘藍汁會根據化學物質的酸鹼度變色。
mt: Kale juice will change color according to the pH of the chemical substance.
ref: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.

src: 酸鹼值 (pH) 是根據化學物質中的氫離子含量而定（pH 的 H 就是指氫）。
mt: The pH value is determined by the amount of hydrogen ions in the chemical substance (the pH of H refers to hydrogen).
ref: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.

src: 氫離子是失去電子後的質子（因為氫原子由一個質子和一個電子組成）。
mt: Hydrogen ions are protons that lose electrons (because hydrogen atoms are composed of a proton and an electron).
ref: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: 將這 2 種乾粉攪拌在一起，接著用沾了水的乾淨雙手將之擠壓成球狀。
mt: Mix the two types of dry powder together, then squeeze them into a ball shape with clean hands that have been dipped in water.
ref: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.

src: 您手上的水分會與外層發生反應，因此產生古怪的觸感並形成一種外殼。
mt: The water in your hand reacts to the outer layer, creating a strange tactile sensation and forming an outer shell.
ref: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.

src: 哈拉帕城和摩亨佐-達羅城的每座房屋裡幾乎都有抽水馬桶，並與一個精密的污水處理系統相連。
mt: In almost every house in the city of Halapa and Mohenzo-Daro, there are flushing toilets connected to a precise sewage treatment system.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.

src: 在希臘克里特島和聖托里尼的米諾斯諸城中，人們在房子底下發現了下水道系統的遺跡。
mt: In the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini, Greece, remnants of a sewer system were found under the house.
ref: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.

src: 在古埃及、波斯和中國也有廁所。羅馬文明中，廁所有時是男女混浴公共澡堂的一部份。
mt: In ancient Egypt, Persia and China, there were also toilets. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public baths for men and women.
ref: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: 打電話給遠在天邊的朋友時，就是透過人造衛星達成的。
mt: When calling friends far away on the sky, it was achieved through artificial satellites.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.

src: 太空中的人造衛星接收到訊號，並在瞬間將訊號反射回地球。
mt: Satellites in space receive signals and instantly reflect them back to Earth.
ref: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.

src: 人造衛星是用火箭送上太空的。科學家在太空中使用望遠鏡，因為地球的大氣有時會扭曲我們的光和視線。
mt: Satellites are rocket-propelled into space. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere sometimes distorts our light and line of sight.
ref: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.

src: 需要超過 100 英尺高的巨型火箭，才能將衛星或望遠鏡放上太空。
mt: A giant rocket over 100 feet tall is needed to put a satellite or telescope into space.
ref: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: 輪子以驚人的方式改變了這個世界。輪子對人類最大的貢獻，就是為我們提供了更簡單、更快速的交通運輸方式。
mt: The wheel has changed the world in an amazing way. The wheel’s greatest contribution to humanity is providing us with a simpler and faster way of transportation.
ref: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.

src: 它已為我們帶來火車、汽車及其他運輸裝置。
mt: It has brought us trains, cars and other transportation devices.
ref: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.

src: 位於牠們之下的是種類較多的中型貓科動物，主要以兔子、羚羊和鹿等中型獵物為食。
mt: Below them are a variety of medium-sized cats, mainly feeding on rabbits, antelopes and deer etc. medium-sized prey.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.

src: 最後許多小型貓（偶有家貓）也會捕食為數眾多的小型獵物，包括昆蟲、齧齒類動物、蜥蜴和鳥類。
mt: Many small cats (even domestic cats) also prey on a large number of small prey, including insects, rodents, lizards and birds.
ref: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.

src: 成功的秘訣在於利基的觀念，也就是每一隻貓要做的工作都是獨特的，如此一來牠們就不會彼此競爭。
mt: The secret of success lies in the niche concept, that is, each cat's work is unique, so they won't compete with each other.
ref: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: 獅子是最群居性的貓科，生活在名為獅群的大團體中。
mt: Lions are the most social cats, living in a large group called lion prides.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.

src: 獅群裡有一到三隻成年公獅，再加上多達三十隻母獅和幼獅組成。
mt: Among the lion prides, there are one to three adult male lions, plus as many as thirty female and juvenile lions.
ref: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.

src: 雌獅通常彼此為近親，是同一大家族中的姐妹和女兒。
mt: Female lions are usually close relatives, sisters and daughters of the same large family.
ref: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.

src: 獅群的行為和狼群或狗群非常相像，這兩種動物意外地和獅子 (但不包括其他大型貓科) 相似，而且也對牠們的獵物非常狠。
mt: The behavior of the lion pride is very similar to that of a wolf pack or dog herd, these two animals are unexpectedly similar to lions (but not other large felines) and also very cruel to their prey.
ref: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: 老虎是全方面的運動員，能攀爬（雖然不太專精）﹑游泳﹑遠距離跳躍並擁有超過一個強壯人類五倍的拉力。
mt: Tigers are all-around athletes, able to climb (although not very specialized), swim, jump over long distances and possess five times the strength of a strong human.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.

src: 老虎和獅子、花豹及美洲豹屬於同一類（豹屬）。只有這四種貓科動物有吼嘯的能力。
mt: Tigers and lions, leopards and jaguars belong to the same class (Leopards). Only these four cats have the ability to roar.
ref: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.

src: 老虎的吼嘯不像獅子全然是嗓音的吼嘯，而比較像是一句混亂、喊叫的話語。
mt: The tiger's roar is not like a lion's full-scale roar, but rather like a chaotic, shouting word.
ref: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: 美洲豹貓喜歡吃小型動物，牠們會獵捕猴子、蛇和齧齒動物，可以的話也會獵捕鳥類。美洲豹貓的獵物幾乎都比牠們的體型小很多。
mt: The jaguars love to eat small animals. They hunt monkeys, snakes and rodents, and if possible, birds. Their prey is almost much smaller than their body size.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.

src: 科學家認為美洲豹貓憑靠嗅覺跟蹤和尋找獵物，用嗅聞的方式找出獵物出沒的地點。
mt: Scientists believe that the jaguar cat relies on its sense of smell to track and search for prey, using smell to find the location where the prey is found.
ref: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.

src: 牠們在夜晚擁有良好的夜視能力，還可以靜悄悄地移動。虎貓狩獵的方式是與周圍環境融為一體，然後再撲向獵物。
mt: They have good night vision at night and can move quietly and quietly. The way the tiger hunts is to blend in with the surrounding environment and then pounce on the prey.
ref: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: 當一小群生物（一個小族群）與他們所來自的主要族群分開時（例如越過山脈或河流，或是移居到新到島嶼，以致無法輕易返回），他們通常會發現自己身處的環境與以往不同。
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small group) is separated from their main group (such as crossing mountains or rivers, or migrating to new islands, making it difficult to easily return), they usually find themselves in an environment different from before.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.

src: 這個新環境有不同的資源和不同的競爭者，因此新人口需要不同的特質或改變，才能具備比過去更強大的競爭力。
mt: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population needs different characteristics or changes in order to have a stronger competitiveness than before.
ref: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.

src: 原本的人口則完全沒有改變，因此仍需要跟以前一樣的適應功能。
mt: The original population has not changed at all, so it still needs the same adaptive function as before.
ref: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.

src: 隨著時間過去，新生人口開始適應新環境，他們的外表便與其他人越來越不同。
mt: As time passed, the newly born population began to adapt to their new environment, and their appearance became increasingly different from others.
ref: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.

src: 最終，經過數千年，或甚至數百萬年，這兩個群體看起來將非常不同，以至於無法稱為相同物種。
mt: Ultimately, after thousands of years, or even hundreds of millions of years, these two groups would look very different to the extent that they cannot be called the same species.
ref: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.

src: 這個過程稱為種化，表示新物種產生。種化是演化過程中無法避免的後果，也是很重要的一環。
mt: This process is called speciation, which means the emergence of new species. Plantation is an inevitable consequence of evolution, and it is also an important part.
ref: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: 植物製造人類吸入的氧氣，並吸收人類呼出的二氧化碳。
mt: Plants produce oxygen that humans inhale, and absorb carbon dioxide exhaled by humans.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).

src: 植物透過光合作用從陽光中獲取養分。植物同時也能提供遮蔽。
mt: Plants obtain nutrients from sunlight through photosynthesis. Plants also provide shade.
ref: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.

src: 我們用植物蓋房子、做衣服，我們所吃的大部份食物也是植物；如果沒有植物的話，動物將無法生存。
mt: We use plants to build houses, make clothes, and most of the food we eat is also plants; if there are no plants, animals will not be able to survive.
ref: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: 滄龍是那個時期的頂層掠食者，因此除了其他的滄龍外，牠們不怕任何生物。
mt: The plesiosaurs were the top predators of that era, so apart from other plesiosaurs, they were not afraid of any living thing.
ref: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.

src: 牠長長的下顎上佈滿了 70 多顆如剃刀般鋒利的牙齒，加上上顎的另一套牙齒，這表示擋在牠眼前的任何生物都無法逃脫。
mt: Its lower jaw is covered with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, plus another set of teeth on the upper jaw, indicating that any living thing in front of it will be unable to escape.
ref: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.

src: 雖然無法確定，但我們認為牠可能有雙分舌。牠會吃烏龜、大型魚類、其他滄龍屬恐龍，甚至可能也會吃同類。
mt: Although it’s uncertain, we think it may have a double tongue. It eats turtles, large fish, other Mosasaur dinosaurs, and possibly even its own kind.
ref: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.

src: 牠也會攻擊所有進入水中的任何東西；即使是像霸王龍這樣的巨型恐龍也不是牠的對手。
mt: It will also attack everything that enters the water; even giant dinosaurs like Tyrannosaurus are not its opponents.
ref: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.

src: 雖然羅馬人的食物對我們來說多半都不陌生，但他們確實會食用一些怪異或罕見的食物，像是野豬、孔雀、蝸牛，以及一種稱作睡鼠的嚙齒動物。
mt: Although the food of the Romans was largely unknown to us, they indeed ate some strange or rare foods such as wild boars, peacocks, snails, and a rodent called sleeper.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse

src: 另一個差別是窮人和女人坐在椅子上吃他們的食物時，富有的男人則喜歡一同參加宴席，並在席間側臥享用他們的大餐。
mt: Another difference is that the poor and women sit on chairs eating their food, while the wealthy men like to attend banquets together and sit side by side enjoying their big meal.
ref: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.

src: 古羅馬的餐飲並不包含日後幾個世紀從美洲或亞洲傳入歐洲的食物。
mt: The cuisine of ancient Rome did not include foods that were introduced to Europe from the Americas or Asia over the centuries.
ref: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.

src: 比方說，他們沒有玉米、番茄、馬鈴薯或可可，古羅馬人也沒吃過火雞。
mt: For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes or cacao; the ancient Romans also never ate turkeys.
ref: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: 巴比倫人為每位神建造一座主要的神廟，那些神廟被視為神的家。
mt: The Babylonians built a main temple for each god, which was considered the home of the gods.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.

src: 人們會準備祭品獻給神，祭司則會透過儀式與節慶，努力滿足神的需求。
mt: People will prepare offerings to the gods, and priests will strive through rituals and festivals to meet the needs of the gods.
ref: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.

src: 每座神廟都有一個開闊的神廟中庭，接著是一間只有祭司才能進入的內部聖殿。
mt: Each temple has an open courtyard of the temple, followed by an internal temple that only priests can enter.
ref: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.

src: 有些廟宇當中還蓋了金字塔型的特殊塔樓，稱為塔廟。
mt: Some temples also built pyramid-shaped special tower buildings, called tower temples.
ref: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.

src: 塔的頂部是神的特殊聖殿。
mt: The top of the tower is a special temple of God.
ref: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: 在中東的溫暖氣候中，房子就沒那麼重要了。
mt: In the warm climate of the Middle East, houses are not that important.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.

src: 猶太家族生活中大多時刻都是在室外度過。
mt: In most Jewish family life, they spend most of their time outdoors.
ref: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.

src: 婦女會在院子裡煮飯；商店不過是一個對著大街的櫃檯。當時的人會用石頭建造房屋。
mt: Women cook in the yard; the shop is just a counter facing the street. People build houses with stones at the time.
ref: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.

src: 迦南的土地上並沒有大片森林，所以木材特別昂貴。
mt: The land of Canaan does not have large forests, so the wood is particularly expensive.
ref: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: 格陵蘭島上人煙稀少。在北歐史詩中，紅髮艾瑞克因謀殺被逐出冰島，當他往更遠的西邊去時，發現了格陵蘭島並為它取了這個名字。
mt: Greenland is sparsely populated. In the Norse epic, Eric was banished from Iceland for his murder, and when he went further west, he discovered Greenland and named it after it.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.

src: 但無論他的發現為何，愛斯基摩部落那時已經居住在那裡了。
mt: But whatever he found, the Eskimo tribe had already lived there at that time.
ref: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.

src: 儘管每個國家都是「斯堪地納維亞人」，但丹麥、瑞典、挪威和冰島的人民、國王、習俗和歷史之間存在許多差異。
mt: Although each country is a "Scandinavian", there are many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: 如果你曾看過電影《國家寶藏》，你可能會以為《美國獨立宣言》的背面畫有一張藏寶圖。
mt: If you've ever seen the film National Treasure, you might think that the back of the Declaration of Independence is a treasure map.
ref: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.

src: 然而，那並非事實。雖然文件背面有一些手寫的內容，但它並不是一張藏寶圖。
mt: However, that’s not true. While there’s some handwritten content on the back of the document, it’s not a treasure map.
ref: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.

src: 《美國獨立宣言》背面的文字是「1776 年 7 月 4 日獨立宣言正本」。文字是以上下顛倒方式寫在底部。
mt: The text on the back of the Declaration of Independence is "the original text of the Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776," written in an upside-down style.
ref: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.

src: 雖然沒人知道這段文字是由誰書寫的，但確定的是這份巨大的羊皮紙文件（長寬約 29¾ 英吋乘以 24½ 英吋）早期為捲起收藏。
mt: Although no one knows who wrote this text, it is certain that this large vellum paper document (about 293⁄4 inches long and 241⁄2 inches wide) was early rolled up for collection.
ref: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.

src: 因此，會加上這段話很有可能只是為了做標示。
mt: Therefore, adding this sentence may be just for marking.
ref: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.

src: 諾曼第登陸與隨後的戰役使法國北部重獲自由，但南部仍未解放。
mt: The Normandy landings and subsequent battles freed northern France, but the south was still unliberated.
ref: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.

src: 當地由法國「維希」人 (Vichy) 所統治。 這些法國人在 1940 年與德國人和睦相處，並與侵略者合作而非對抗。
mt: It was ruled by the French Vichy. The French lived in peace with the Germans in 1940 and cooperated with the invaders rather than against them.
ref: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.

src: 1940 年 8 月 15 日，同盟國進攻法國南部，史稱「龍騎兵行動」。
mt: On August 15, 1940, the Allies attacked southern France, known as the "Dragon Cavalry Operation."
ref: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".

src: 在短短兩週內，美軍和自由法國軍就解放了南法，並轉向德國。
mt: In just two weeks, the US military and the Free French Army liberated southern France and turned to Germany.
ref: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.

src: 文明是由一群數量顯著且以協作方式生活與工作的群眾（亦即社會）所共享的獨特文化。
mt: Civilization is a unique culture shared by a group of people (i.e. society) who live and work in a collaborative way, with a significant number.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.

src: 「文明」這個詞來自拉丁文的「civilis」，意思是「公民的」。它與拉丁文中的「civis」和「civitas」有關，意思分別是「公民」和「城市或城邦」，這在某方面來說也定義了社會的規模。
mt: The word "civilization" comes from the Latin word "civilis", meaning "citizen's". It is related to the Latin words "civis" and "civitas", meaning "citizen" and "city or city-state", which in some ways also define the size of society.
ref: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.

src: 城邦是國家的前身，文明文化意指傳承數個世代的知識、綿延不斷的文化足跡與普遍的傳播。
mt: City-states are the predecessors of a nation, cultural civilization refers to the transmission of knowledge for several generations, continuous cultural footprints and widespread dissemination.
ref: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.

src: 規模較小的文化往往不留歷史痕跡便消失殆盡，無法被認定為正統文明。
mt: Smaller-scale cultures often disappear without historical traces, and cannot be considered as orthodox civilization.
ref: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: 在獨立戰爭期間，這十三個州首先根據《邦聯條例》成立了脆弱的中央政府（而國會是它唯一的機構）。
mt: During the War of Independence, these thirteen states first established a fragile central government (and parliament was its only institution) under the Confederation Ordinance.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.

src: 國會沒有權力徵稅，又因為沒有國家行政或司法部門，所以必須仰賴往往互不合作的各州權力機構執行法律。
mt: Congress has no power to collect taxes, and because there is no national administrative or judicial department, it must rely on the often non-cooperation state power agencies to enforce laws.
ref: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.

src: 它也沒有權力撤銷州與州之間的稅法和關稅。
mt: It also has no power to revoke state-to-state tax laws and tariffs.
ref: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.

src: 這些條例需要所有州全體一致的同意才能進行修改，而各州對中央政府的態度非常草率，他們的代表時常缺席。
mt: These regulations require the unanimous consent of all states in order to be amended, and the attitude of each state towards the central government is very sloppy, their representatives are often absent.
ref: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: 義大利國家足球隊和德國國家足球隊均是世界第二成功的球隊，他們也是 2006 年國際足球總會世界盃的冠軍。
mt: The Italian national football team and the German national football team are both world's second most successful teams, and they are also champions of the 2006 FIFA World Cup.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.

src: 熱門運動包括足球、籃球、排球、水球、擊劍、橄欖球、自行車、冰上曲棍球、直排輪曲棍球和 F1 賽車。
mt: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, inline skating and F1 racing.
ref: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.

src: 冬季運動項目在北部地區最受歡迎，這裡的義大利人也會參與相關的國際和奧林匹克賽事。
mt: Winter sports events are most popular in the northern region, where Italians also participate in related international and Olympic events.
ref: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: 日本擁有將近 7,000 座島嶼（其中最大的一座是本州），使得日本成為世界第 7 大島！
mt: Japan has nearly 7,000 islands (the largest of which is Honshu), making it the world's seventh largest island!
ref: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!

src: 由於日本有一群 / 組島嶼，以地理學的觀點來看，日本常被歸類為「群島」
mt: Due to the fact that Japan has a group of islands, from a geographical perspective, Japan is often classified as an "island"
ref: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"

src: 臺灣的歷史開端可以追溯到 15 世紀，當時的歐洲水手在經過時把這座島的名字記錄為福爾摩沙，意思是美麗的島嶼。
mt: The history of Taiwan can be traced back to the 15th century, when European sailors at that time recorded the name of this island as Formosa, meaning a beautiful island.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.

src: 1624 年，荷蘭東印度公司在臺灣西南部建立一處基地，開啟了原住民穀物生產方式的轉型，並雇用中國勞工在該公司的水稻及甘蔗田裡工作。
mt: In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, opening a transformation of the indigenous grain production method and employing Chinese workers to work in the company's rice and sugarcane fields.
ref: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.

src: 1683 年，清朝（1644-1912 年）政府以武力掌控了臺灣西部及北部沿海地區，並於 1885 年宣布臺灣是清朝的一省。
mt: In 1683, the Qing government (1644-1912) used force to control the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan, and in 1885 declared Taiwan a province of the Qing dynasty.
ref: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.

src: 1895 年，清朝政府在甲午戰爭（1894-1895 年）戰敗後簽下了《馬關條約》，將臺灣主權割讓給日本。日本從此開始統治臺灣，直到 1945 年為止。
mt: In 1895, the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki after the defeat of the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895) to cede sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan. Japan then began to rule Taiwan until 1945.
ref: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: 馬丘比丘由三個主要結構組成，分別為栓日石、太陽神廟與三窗廟。
mt: The Machu Picchu is composed of three main structures, respectively, the sculpted sun stone, the temple of the sun and the temple of three windows.
ref: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.

src: 遺蹟群邊緣大部分的建築都已經過重建，好讓遊客更加暸解原本的樣貌。
mt: Most of the buildings on the periphery of the relics have been rebuilt, so that visitors can better understand their original appearance.
ref: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.

src: 到了 1976 年，百分之三十的馬丘比丘已被修復，且修復工作一直持續到今日。
mt: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been repaired and the repair work continued to this day.
ref: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.

src: 舉例來說，世界上最普遍的靜態圖像攝影格式是 35 釐米，這也是類比底片時代結束時的主要底片尺寸。
mt: For example, the most common static image photography format in the world is 35 millimeters, which is also the main film size at the end of the analog film era.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.

src: 它至今日仍持續在生產，不過更重要的是，數位相機的感光元件規格沿用了其長寬比。
mt: It is still being produced today, but more importantly, the image sensor specifications of digital cameras have retained its aspect ratio.
ref: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.

src: 事實上，那 35 公釐的格式有些令人困惑，寬 36 公釐，高 24 公釐。
mt: In fact, the 35mm format is somewhat confusing, 36mm wide and 24mm high.
ref: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.

src: 此格式的長寬比（除以 12，以獲得最簡單整數比）因此稱為 3:2。
mt: This format's length-to-width ratio (divided by 12 to get the simplest integer ratio) is therefore called 3:2.
ref: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.

src: 許多常見格式（比方 APS 先進攝影系統格式）都等同或接近這個長寬比。
mt: Many common formats (such as the APS Advanced Photography System format) are equivalent to or close to this aspect ratio.
ref: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: 常被濫用和嘲笑的三分法是種簡單的指導方針，在創造活力的同時，也使畫面保持井然有序。
mt: The commonly abused and mocked three-point method is a simple guiding principle, creating vitality while also keeping the picture in order.
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.

src: 它指出將圖像垂直和水平三等分後，線條的交點便是拍攝主體最有效的位置（見範例）。
mt: It points out that after dividing the image vertically and horizontally, the intersection point of the line is the most effective position for the subject (see example).
ref: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: 在歐洲歷史的這段時期，已變得富有且強大的天主教教會受到了嚴格的審視。
mt: During this period of European history, the wealthy and powerful Catholic Church was strictly scrutinized.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.

src: 一千多年來，儘管依然存在語言和習俗的差異，基督教仍讓歐洲各國緊密相連。
mt: For over a thousand years, despite still existing differences in language and customs, Christianity has been closely linked to various European countries.
ref: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I

src: 其無所不在的能力影響所有人，上至國王，下至平民。
mt: Its omnipresent ability affects everyone, from king to commoner.
ref: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.

src: 基督教有一條主要信條，亦即財富必須用於幫助受苦與貧窮的人，而教堂的資金就是特別為這種理由設立的。
mt: Christianity has a main creed, that wealth must be used to help the suffering and the poor, and the church's funds are specifically set up for this reason.
ref: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.

src: 一千多年來，教會的權力核心都位於羅馬，這種權力與金錢的集中，令許多人質疑教會是否確實遵循這項信條。
mt: For over a thousand years, the power core of the church was located in Rome, this concentration of power and money has led many people to question whether the church indeed followed this creed.
ref: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: 戰爭爆發後不久，英國便開始對德國發起海上封鎖。
mt: Soon after the outbreak of war, Britain began to launch a sea blockade against Germany.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.

src: 這套切斷必要軍事及民生物資供應的戰略確實奏效，雖然這種封鎖方式已違反過去兩個世紀以來，透過多項國際協議所制定且普遍為各國接受的國際法規。
mt: This strategy of cutting off the supply of necessary military and civilian supplies has indeed been effective, although this blockade method has violated international regulations established through multiple international agreements over the past two centuries and widely accepted by all countries.
ref: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.

src: 英國在國際海域布置水雷，以防止任何船隻進入整個海域，甚至危害到中立船隻。
mt: The UK has installed mines in international waters to prevent any ships from entering the entire area, and even endangering neutral ships.
ref: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.

src: 由於各國對此戰術沒什麼反應，德國因此認為他們的無限制潛艇戰也不會招致強烈反彈。
mt: Due to the lack of response from various countries on this strategy, Germany therefore believed that their unrestricted submarine warfare would not provoke a strong backlash.
ref: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: 1920 年代，多數公民與國家的普遍態度是和平主義與孤立主義。
mt: In the 1920s, the general attitude of most citizens and countries was pacifism and isolationism.
ref: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.

src: 見證第一次世界大戰的恐懼和暴行後，各國均希望避免這種情況未來再次發生。
mt: Witnessing the horrors and atrocities of World War I, all countries hoped to avoid such a situation from happening again in the future.
ref: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.

src: 1884 年，特斯拉搬到了美國，在紐約市接受了愛迪生公司的一份工作。
mt: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States, where he accepted a job at Edison in New York City.
ref: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.

src: 他帶著 4 美分、一本詩集和查爾斯·巴徹勒（他前份工作的經理）為他寫給湯瑪斯·愛迪生的推薦信來到美國。
mt: He came to the United States with a four-cent, a collection of poems and a recommendation letter he wrote to Thomas Edison (his former manager) for him.
ref: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.

src: 古代中國使用獨特的方式來表示不同的時期；中國的各個階段或掌權的各家族都屬於截然不同的王朝。
mt: In ancient China, a unique way was used to represent different periods; each stage or ruling family in China belonged to a completely different dynasty.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.

src: 而改朝換代之際也是各地分裂動盪的時期。其中最著名的就是漢朝和晉朝之間 60 年的三國時代。
mt: The most famous of these was the 60-year period of the Three Kingdoms period between the Han and Jin dynasties.
ref: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.

src: 在這些時期中，許多貴族之間為了爭奪王位，進行了激烈的戰爭。
mt: During these periods, many nobles engaged in fierce wars over the throne.
ref: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.

src: 三國是中國古代歷史上最血腥的時代之一，成千上萬的人為爭奪坐上西安宏偉皇宮中的王位，而失去生命。
mt: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in ancient Chinese history, with thousands losing their lives to claim the throne at the grand imperial palace in Xi'an.
ref: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: 革命產生許多社會和政治層面的影響，例如採用公制度量衡、專制主義改為共和主義和民族主義，以及國家屬於人民而非君主獨有的信念。
mt: The revolution produced many social and political impacts, such as the adoption of a system of checks and balances, authoritarianism becoming republicanism and nationalism, and the belief that the state belongs to the people rather than the monarch.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.

src: 且在革命之後，各種職缺都開放給所有主動求職的男性，讓最有意願和成就者得以接掌。
mt: After the revolution, all kinds of job openings were opened to all men who actively sought employment, allowing those with the most desire and achievements to take over.
ref: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.

src: 同樣的情形也發生在軍隊裡，因為他們此時已不用階級來區分軍階，而是以才幹為基準。
mt: The same phenomenon also occurs in the military, because they no longer need to distinguish ranks from ranks, but rather rely on talent as a basis.
ref: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.

src: 法國大革命也啟發了許多其他國家的受迫勞工階級展開革命。
mt: The French Revolution also inspired many other countries' forced labor classes to launch revolution.
ref: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: 穆罕默德對於超脫這個世俗世界的事物深感興趣。他常去「努爾」（光）山上一個叫做「西拉 (Hira)」的洞穴冥想。
mt: Muhammad was deeply interested in the things that transcended the world. He often went to meditation on a cave called Hira on the mountain of light.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.

src: 洞窟本身歷經時代更迭，呈現出生動的穆罕默德精神面向。
mt: The cave itself has undergone a series of changes over time, presenting a vivid and lively perspective of Muhammad's spirit.
ref: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.

src: 這座山洞位於麥加北方的一座山頂上，徹底與外面的世界隔絕。
mt: This cave is located on a mountain top north of Mecca, completely isolated from the outside world.
ref: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.

src: 實際上，即便有人知道它的存在也不容易找到。一旦進到山洞內，就完全與世隔絕。
mt: In fact, even if some people know of its existence, it is not easy to find. Once inside the cave, it is completely isolated from the world.
ref: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.

src: 除了上方晴朗美麗的天空和周圍群山，其他什麼都看不到；洞穴內部只能看到或聽到一小部分的世界。
mt: Except for the clear and beautiful sky above and surrounding mountains, nothing else can be seen; only a small part of the world can be seen or heard inside the cave.
ref: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: 吉薩大金字塔是現今唯一仍矗立的世界七大奇蹟。
mt: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only remaining seven wonders in the world today.
ref: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.

src: 大金字塔在公元前三世紀由埃及人建造而成，它是建來紀念已故法老的眾多大型金字塔建築物之一。
mt: The Great Pyramid was built by the Egyptians in the 3rd century BC, and it is one of many large pyramidal buildings built to commemorate the deceased pharaoh.
ref: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.

src: 位於埃及亡者谷的吉薩高原或「吉薩金字塔群」，包含好幾座金字塔（其中大金字塔是世界上最大的金字塔）、幾座小陵墓、幾座神廟和巨大的獅身人面像。
mt: Located in the Valley of the Dead of Egypt's Giza Plateau or "Giza Pyramids Group", it includes several pyramids (the largest pyramid in the world), several small tombs, several temples and a large lion-headed human face.
ref: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.

src: 大金字塔是為了榮耀古夫法老所建造的，而許多較小的金字塔、陵墓和神廟則是為了榮耀古夫的妻妾和家庭成員而建。
mt: The Great Pyramid was built to honor the Pharaoh, while many smaller pyramids, mausoleums and temples were built to honor his wives and family members.
ref: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.

src: 「上弓」標記長得像 V，「下弓」標記長得像訂書針，也像是底部開口的方形。
mt: The "upper bow" mark looks like a V, the "downbow" mark looks like a staple, and it also looks like a square in the bottom opening.
ref: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.

src: 上表示您應該從弓尖開始推弓，下表示您應該從弓根（您的手握住弓的地方）開始拉弓。
mt: The above indicates that you should start pushing the bow from the tip of the bow, and the bottom indicates that you should start drawing the bow from the root of the bow (where your hand holds the bow).
ref: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.

src: 上弓記號通常代表的是比較輕柔的聲響，而下弓記號則代表比較強烈又比較堅定的聲響。
mt: The upper bow mark usually represents a softer sound, while the lower bow mark represents a more intense and firmer sound.
ref: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.

src: 請隨意用鉛筆做記號，但請記得，頁面上印出的運弓記號都有音樂上的作用，所以不應忽略。
mt: Please use a pencil to mark as you like, but remember that the bow marks printed on the page have a musical effect, so we should not ignore them.
ref: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.

src: 飽受驚嚇的國王路易十六、王后瑪麗．安東尼和他們的兩個孩子（11歲的瑪麗泰瑞絲及 4 歲的路易查爾斯）以及國王的妹妹伊莉莎白公主，於 1789 年 10 月 6 日被一群市集婦女逼迫從凡爾賽宮遷回巴黎。
mt: King Louis XVI, Queen Mary Anthony and their two children (11-year-old Mary Teresa and four-year-old Louis Charles) and the king's sister Princess Elizabeth were forced by a group of women from the market to move back to Paris on October 6, 1789.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.

src: 他們搭乘馬車返回巴黎，沿途被一群暴民包圍，民眾對著國王和王后叫囂、口出威脅。
mt: They took a carriage back to Paris, where they were surrounded by a mob along the way, with the crowd shouting and threatening the king and queen.
ref: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.

src: 暴民迫使國王和皇后敞開馬車的窗戶。
mt: The mob forced the king and queen to open the carriage window.
ref: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.

src: 某刻，一名暴徒成員甚至在驚恐的皇后面前揮舞著王室衛兵的頭顱，該衛兵在在凡爾賽宮被殺。
mt: At a certain moment, a mob member even waved the head of the royal guards in front of the terrified queen, who was killed at the Palace of Versailles.
ref: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: 美國帝國主義征戰菲律賓的戰爭支出則由菲律賓人民自身繳納。
mt: The war expenses of the US imperialism war in the Philippines were paid by the Filipino people themselves.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.

src: 他們被迫繳稅給美國殖民政權，支付大部分的政府開支，而債券利息則以菲律賓政府的名義透過華爾街銀行浮動。
mt: They were forced to pay taxes to the US colonial regime, paying most of the government's expenses, while bond interest floated through Wall Street Bank in the name of the Philippine government.
ref: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.

src: 當然，美國長久以來剝削菲律賓人取得的超高利潤，成為美國帝國主義的基本收穫。
mt: Of course, the United States has long exploited Filipinos for extremely high profits, becoming a basic harvest of American imperialism.
ref: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: 若要了解聖殿騎士團，就必須了解促使這個組織創立的脈絡。
mt: To understand the Knights Templar, it is necessary to understand the context that led to the establishment of this organization.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.

src: 通常把這些事件發生的時代稱為中古盛期，也就是歐洲歷史的 11、12 和 13 世紀（西元 1000–1300 年）。
mt: These events are usually referred to as the Middle Ages, i.e., the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries (1000-1300 AD) of European history.
ref: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).

src: 中世紀中期前承中世紀前期、後接中世紀後期，而傳統上認為中世紀結束於 1500 年左右。
mt: In the Middle Ages, it was traditionally believed to have ended around 1500 AD, following the Middle Ages in the early and late Middle Ages.
ref: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: 科技決定論這個詞彙涵蓋了許多已實踐的概念，從技術推動或科技主導型變革，一直到較嚴謹「科學定律與科學在科技中的表現形式背後的相關邏輯會推動人類命運」。
mt: The term "scientific determinism" encompasses many practical concepts, from technologically driven or technologically driven change to a more rigorous "scientific law and the logic behind the manifestation of science in technology will drive human destiny".
ref: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.

src: 多數對於科技決定論的詮釋都有兩個主要理念：科技本身的發展途徑遠比文化或政治因素有著更大之影響力，以及科技反過來會「影響」社會固有型態，而非受社會制約。
mt: Most interpretations of technological determinism have two main ideas: the development path of technology itself is far more influential than cultural or political factors, and technology will in turn "influence" the inherent social form rather than being constrained by society.
ref: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.

src: 舉例來說，有人說汽車必然會推動道路發展。
mt: For example, some people say that cars will inevitably drive road development.
ref: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.

src: 然而，為了少數汽車打造全國性公路網絡並不符合經濟效應，人們因而發展出新的製造方法，以減少汽車的持有成本。
mt: However, building a national highway network for a few cars did not conform to economic effects, and people thus developed new manufacturing methods to reduce the cost of ownership of cars.
ref: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.

src: 擁有車子的人變多，也會使道路意外的機率變高，進而使人類發展出修復受傷肢體的新醫護技術。
mt: The increasing number of people with cars will also increase the probability of road accidents, which in turn leads to the development of new medical technology for repairing injured limbs.
ref: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.

src: 文化決定論是浪漫主義的重要構成之一，多取材自歌德、費希特和施萊格爾等作家。
mt: Cultural determinism is an important component of romanticism, often derived from writers such as Goethe, Fechett and Schlegel.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.

src: 在浪漫主義的脈絡中，地理環境塑造了個體，且隨著時間的推移產生出與該地理環境相關的習俗和文化。這些習俗和文化由於與當地社會和諧一致，所以比武斷地實施的法律更好。
mt: In the context of Romanticism, the geographical environment shapes the individual and over time produces customs and cultures related to that geographical environment. These customs and cultures are better than the law of arbitrary implementation because of their harmony with the local society.
ref: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: 如同巴黎被譽為當代世界的時尚之都，君士坦丁堡也被譽為封建歐洲的時尚之都。
mt: Like Paris being hailed as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was also known as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
ref: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.

src: 它作為奢華中心的名聲，約始於西元 400 年，並一路持續到西元 1100 年左右。
mt: Its reputation as a luxury center began around 400 AD and continued until around 1100 AD.
ref: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.

src: 它的地位在 12 世紀漸漸走下坡，主要是因為十字軍已帶著絲綢和香料等伴手禮返回，這些禮物比拜占庭市場賣的東西還有價值。
mt: Its position gradually declined in the 12th century, mainly because the Crusaders had returned with gifts such as silk and spices, which were more valuable than what the Byzantine market sold.
ref: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.

src: 就是在此時，時尚之都的頭銜從君士坦丁堡轉移到了巴黎。
mt: It was at this time that the title of fashion capital was transferred from Constantinople to Paris.
