ref: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.

src: 哥德式風格在 10 到 11 世紀間和 14 世紀達到高峰。
mt: Gothic style reached its peak in the 10th to 11th centuries and 14th centuries.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.

src: 起初，衣著受到東方拜占庭文化很大的影響。
mt: Initially, clothing was greatly influenced by Eastern Byzantine culture.
ref: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.

src: 然而，由於溝通管道的緩慢，西方的風格可能落後 25 到 30 年。
mt: However, due to the slowness of communication channels, Western styles may be 25 to 30 years behind.
ref: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.

src: 中世紀末期，西歐開始發展獨特的風格。當時的一大進展，就是十字軍成員開始用釦子固定衣服。
mt: At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own unique style. One of the great developments of the time was that the Crusaders started to fix their clothes with buttons.
ref: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: 自給自足式農業是作物產量只足夠讓農人和其家人溫飽的農業型態。
mt: Self-sufficient agriculture is an agricultural mode where crop yields are only sufficient for farmers and their families to be fed.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.

src: 自給自足式農業是一種單純的農業系統，通常採行有機耕種，保留並使用當地生態區原生作物的種子，採用輪作或其他相對簡單的技術來增加產量。
mt: Self-sufficient agriculture is a simple agricultural system, usually adopting organic farming, preserving and using the seeds of native crops in local ecological areas, adopting rotation or other relatively simple technologies to increase production.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.

src: 歷史上，大部分的農民都從事自給自足農業，且許多開發中國家依舊如此。
mt: Historically, most farmers have been engaged in self-sufficient agriculture, and many developing countries still do so.
ref: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: 次文化讓喜好相似、且同樣覺得受社會主流忽視的人聚在一起，進而產生身分認同感。
mt: Subculture brings together people who like to be similar, and also feel neglected by mainstream society, thereby generating an identity sense.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.

src: 次文化會因為成員的年齡層、種族、階級、地理位置或性別而特色鮮明。
mt: Subcultures are characterized by their age group, race, class, geographical location or gender.
ref: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.

src: 使次文化得以確立的特質可能為語言、美學、宗教、政治、性別、地理或各種因素的結合。
mt: The characteristics that enable subcultures to be established may be the combination of language, aesthetics, religion, politics, gender, geography, or various factors.
ref: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.

src: 次文化的成員通常透過特殊、有象徵意義的形式彰顯他們的屬於該群體，其中包括穿著打扮、行為舉止及暗語的使用。
mt: Members of the subculture typically manifest their belonging to that group through special, symbolic forms, including dress, behavior and phrasing.
ref: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: 常用於說明社會化重要性的一種方法，是舉幾則孩童在成長過程中遭受忽視、厄運或蓄意虐待，因而未獲得成人賦予社會化過程的不幸案例。
mt: One method commonly used to explain the importance of socialization is to point out a few children who are neglected, doomed or intentionally abused during their growth process, thus failing to obtain an unfortunate case of adult socialization process.
ref: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.

src: 這種兒童稱為「野孩子」。有些野孩子曾遭受監禁（同常是父母）；在某些情況下，孩子遭到棄養是因為父母不接受孩子的智力或身體有嚴重缺陷。
mt: This type of child is called a “wild child”. Some wild children have been imprisoned (often parents); in some cases, the child is abandoned because the parents do not accept the child’s intelligence or physical impairment.
ref: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.

src: 流浪兒童被棄養或逃家前可能經歷嚴重受虐或創傷。
mt: Stray children may experience severe abuse or trauma before being abandoned or fleeing.
ref: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.

src: 其他孩子據稱是由動物撫養長大；有些據說獨自在野外生活。
mt: Other children are said to be raised by animals; some are said to live alone in the wild.
ref: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.

src: 如果野孩子完全由非人類動物扶養長大，則會表現出與照顧他的動物幾乎完全相同的行為 (生理條件允許下)，例如對人類表現出害怕或冷漠的態度。
mt: If a wild child is completely raised by non-human animals, it will exhibit behavior that is almost identical to that of the animal taking care of him (under physiological conditions allowing), such as an attitude of fear or indifference towards humans.
ref: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.

src: 以專案為基礎的學習方式讓學習更容易也更有趣，鷹架式學習則又更上一層樓。
mt: Project-based learning methods make learning easier and more interesting, while scaffold-based learning takes the next level.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.

src: 鷹架式教學並非學習方法，而是一種輔助，可為正在經歷新學習體驗（如使用新電腦程式或開始新專案等）的人提供支援。
mt: Scaffolded teaching is not a learning method, but rather an auxiliary method that can provide support for those who are experiencing new learning experiences (such as using new computer programs or starting new projects, etc.).
ref: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.

src: 鷹架既可虛擬也可實體，換句話說，教師和 Microsoft Office 的迴紋針小幫手都是一種鷹架的型態。
mt: The scaffold can be either virtual or physical. In other words, teachers and Microsoft Office's Paperclip Helper are both in the form of a scaffold.
ref: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.

src: 虛擬鷹架已內建在軟體中，功能是提問、提示和說明學生可能難以獨自處理的程序。
mt: Virtual scaffolding has been built into software, with functions such as asking questions, prompting and explaining programs that students may find difficult to handle alone.
ref: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: 兒童被送往寄養中心的原因眾多，包括疏於照顧、虐待，甚至勒索。
mt: The reasons why children are sent to foster homes are numerous, including neglect, abuse and even extortion.
ref: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.

src: 沒有任何孩童應在缺乏養育、關照與教育的環境下長大，但現實並非如此。
mt: No child should grow up in an environment lacking upbringing, care and education, but this is not the case in reality.
ref: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.

src: 我們認為寄養系統是這些孩童的避風港。
mt: We think that foster care is a safe haven for these children.
ref: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.

src: 我們的寄養系統應當提供安全的住家、充滿關愛的照顧者、穩定的教育和可靠的醫療照護。
mt: Our foster care system should provide a safe home, caring carers, stable education and reliable medical care.
ref: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.

src: 寄養家庭應該要提供他們在先前家庭缺少的所有必需品。
mt: Foster families should provide them with all the necessities that they lacked in their previous families.
ref: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.

src: 網路結合了大眾與人際溝通這兩種元素。
mt: The Internet combines the two elements of mass and interpersonal communication.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.

src: 從使用和滿足的途徑來看，網際網路的鮮明特性開啟了新的境界。
mt: From a path of use and satisfaction, the distinctive characteristics of the Internet have opened up a new frontier.
ref: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.

src: 舉例來說，「學習」和「社會化」皆可說是使用網際網路的重要動機（詹姆斯等，1995 年）。
mt: For example, both "learning" and "socialization" can be said to be important motivations for using the Internet (James et al., 1995).
ref: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).

src: Eighmey and McCord (1998) 論文中調查受眾對網站的反應時，發現「個人參與」及「持續性關係」同樣也是新的動機層面。
mt: Eighmey and McCord (1998) found that both "personal engagement" and "persistent relationships" were also new levels of motivation when investigating audience reactions to the website.
ref: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: 錄影的運用已為解讀微表情和僅維持幾毫秒的臉部動作帶來重大的發現。
mt: The use of video recording has brought significant discoveries to interpret microexpressions and facial movements that only last for a few milliseconds.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.

src: 特別是，有人認為可以透過正確解讀微表情，來偵測一個人是否在說謊。
mt: Especially, some people believe that it can be used to correctly interpret microexpressions to detect whether a person is lying.
ref: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.

src: 奧利佛‧薩克斯在他的文章〈總統的演講〉中，指出因為腦部受損而無法理解演講內容的人，仍然可以準確感受到演講者的誠意。
mt: In his article "The President's Speech", Oliver Sax noted that people who are unable to understand the content of the speech due to brain damage can still accurately feel the sincerity of the speaker.
ref: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.

src: 他甚至認為，家犬等動物可能都有這種解釋人類行為的能力。
mt: He even believes that domestic dogs and other animals may have this ability to explain human behavior.
ref: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: 二十世紀的研究顯示有兩種基因變異：隱性和顯性。
mt: Research in the 20th century showed two types of genetic variation: implicit and dominant.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.

src: 突變會增加新的基因變異，而天擇則會將其從顯性變異庫中移除。
mt: Mutations will increase new genetic variants, and natural selection will remove them from the dominant variant library.
ref: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.

src: 每一個世代，分離和重組會使得顯性和隱性兩組基因不斷產生變化。
mt: Each generation, separation and recombination will make the dominant and implicit two sets of genes constantly change.
ref: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: 消化系統類似人類的靈長動物，難以從大草原上的植物攝取足夠的胺基酸。
mt: The digestive system is similar to that of human primates, making it difficult to obtain sufficient amino acids from plants on the grassland.
ref: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.

src: 此外，胺基酸攝取不足會導致嚴重的後果：生長不良及營養不良，最終導致死亡。
mt: In addition, insufficient amino acid intake will lead to severe consequences: poor growth and malnutrition, ultimately leading to death.
ref: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.

src: 最方便取用的植物資源應是葉子和莢豆中可取得的蛋白質，但除非經過烹調，不然對像我們這樣的靈長類動物來說它們很難消化。
mt: The most convenient plant resources are the proteins that can be obtained from leaves and pods, but unless cooked, they are difficult to digest for primates like us.
ref: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.

src: 相對地，動物性食物 (螞蟻、白蟻、蛋) 不僅容易消化，並且提供含有所有必要胺基酸的優質蛋白。
mt: Compared to that, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) are not only easy to digest, but also provide high-quality proteins containing all necessary amino acids.
ref: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.

src: 考量所有因素後，如果我們的祖先解決「蛋白質問題」的方式與現今莽原上的黑猩猩類似，我們也無須感到驚訝。
mt: After considering all the factors, if our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in a way similar to that of chimpanzees in present-day Mangwon, we wouldn't be surprised.
ref: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.

src: 睡眠中斷意指刻意在一般的睡眠期間醒來，又在短時間內（10-60 分鐘後）入睡的過程。
mt: Sleep disruption refers to the process of waking up intentionally during a normal sleep period and falling asleep again in a short period of time (10-60 minutes).
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).

src: 藉由使用相對安靜的鬧鐘，讓你有意識卻不會完全醒來，就能輕鬆做到這件事。
mt: By using a relatively quiet alarm clock, you can easily do this by making you conscious but not waking up completely.
ref: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.

src: 如果你發現自己會在睡夢中重設鬧鐘，你可以把鬧鐘放在房間的另一邊，強迫自己下床關掉鬧鐘。
mt: If you find yourself setting your alarm clock in your sleep, you can place it on the other side of the room and force yourself to get out of bed and turn it off.
ref: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.

src: 其他基於生理週期的選擇包括在睡前喝下大量液體（尤其是水或茶，一種公認的利尿劑），使人不得不起床排尿。
mt: Other options based on physiological cycles include drinking a large amount of liquid (especially water or tea, a widely recognized diuretic) before bedtime, forcing people to wake up and urinate.
ref: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: 一個人內心的平靜程度，與一個人身心的緊張程度呈反比。
mt: The degree of inner calm in a person is inversely proportional to the degree of physical and mental tension in a person.
ref: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.

src: 身心越放鬆，擁有的生命力就越強。每個人都有潛力找到絕對的平和與滿足。
mt: The more relaxed the body and mind, the stronger the vitality. Everyone has the potential to find absolute peace and satisfaction.
ref: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.

src: 所有人都能達到開悟的境界。開悟之道上唯一的障礙是我們自身的焦慮與負面能量。
mt: Everyone can reach enlightenment. The only obstacle to enlightenment is our own anxiety and negative energy.
ref: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.

src: 藏傳佛教以佛陀的教義為基礎，但因大乘佛教的愛之道路與印度瑜伽的許多技巧，使得藏傳佛教得以發揚光大。
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of the Buddha, but due to the love path of Mahayana Buddhism and many techniques of Indian yoga, Tibetan Buddhism was able to flourish and flourish.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.

src: 藏傳佛教原則上非常簡單，包括亢達里尼瑜伽、冥想和擁抱眾生的奉愛修行。
mt: In principle, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple, including Khamdarini yoga, meditation and the devotional practice of embracing all living beings.
ref: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.

src: 在做昆達里尼瑜珈時，昆達里尼能量（啟蒙能量）會透過瑜珈動作、呼吸運動、曼特羅禱文和視覺化而甦醒。
mt: During the practice of kundalini yoga, kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga movements, breathing exercises, mantra prayers and visualization.
ref: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.

src: 藏傳佛教的冥想核心是本尊瑜伽。透過觀想神佛，淨化所有的能量通道，啟動脈輪，建立開悟意識。
mt: In Tibetan Buddhism, the core of meditation is Yoga Tantra. By observing the Buddha, all energy channels are purified, the chakra is activated, and enlightenment consciousness is established.
ref: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: 德國是二戰時期的共同敵人，促使蘇聯與美國合作。隨著戰爭結束，制度、做法和文化方面的衝突使這些國家有了嫌隙。
mt: Germany was a common enemy of World War II, and it was the Soviet Union and the United States that collaborated. As the war came to an end, conflicts over institutions, practices, and culture created tensions between these countries.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.

src: 二戰結束不過兩年，原本的盟友就成了敵人，冷戰開始。
mt: Just two years after World War II ended, the original allies became enemies, and the Cold War began.
ref: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.

src: 它接連持續了四十年，並由代理軍隊在從非洲到亞洲，在阿富汗﹑古巴和許多其他地方的戰場上進行真正的戰鬥。
mt: It continued for forty consecutive years, and was fought by proxy troops on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: 在 1939 年 9 月 17 日之時，波蘭防線已失守，唯一的希望是撤退，並在羅馬尼亞的橋頭堡旁重新整頓。
mt: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defensive line had been lost, with only hope of retreating and reorganizing beside a bridgehead in Romania.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.

src: 然而，這些計畫在一夜之間全都報廢了。超過 80 萬名蘇聯紅軍違反《里加和約》、《波蘇互不侵犯協定》和其它雙邊與多邊的國際協定入侵波蘭東部，並在隨後進入白俄羅斯與烏克蘭，形成白俄羅斯與烏克蘭戰線。
mt: However, all of these plans were scrapped overnight. More than 800,000 Soviet Red Army troops invaded eastern Poland in violation of the Treaty of Riga, the Polish-Soviet Non-Aggression Pact, and other bilateral and multilateral international agreements, and then entered Belarus and Ukraine, forming the Belarus-Ukraine front.
ref: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: 使用船運送貨物，是目前為止跨海移動大量人員和貨物的最有效率方式。
mt: The most efficient way to move a large number of people and goods across the sea is by ship.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.

src: 傳統上，海軍的任務是確保國家可安穩地轉移人民和貨物，同時干擾敵國轉移人員和貨物的作業。
mt: Traditionally, the Navy's mission was to ensure that the country could safely transfer people and goods, while interfering with the operation of enemy countries transferring personnel and goods.
ref: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.

src: 其中近代最值得關注的例子之一，是第二次世界大戰的北大西洋戰役。美國人試圖將人員和物資運送到大西洋的另外一邊，以幫助英國。
mt: One of the most notable examples of modern times is the Battle of the North Atlantic during World War II. Americans are trying to transport people and supplies to the other side of the Atlantic to help Britain.
ref: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.

src: 於此同時，德國海軍則試圖阻斷運輸（主要使用 U 型潛艇）。
mt: At the same time, the German Navy attempted to block transportation (mainly using U-boats).
ref: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.

src: 如果盟軍戰敗，德國可能會像征服歐洲其他地區一樣征服英國。
mt: If the Allies were defeated, Germany might conquer Britain like other parts of Europe.
ref: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: 山羊似乎是在一萬年前左右，在伊朗的札格洛斯山脈首次被馴養的。
mt: It seems that goats were first domesticated around 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.

src: 古文化與部落開始飼養牠們以便取得奶、毛、肉與皮。
mt: Ancient cultures and tribes began to raise them to obtain milk, fur, meat, and skin.
ref: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.

src: 馴養山羊一般放養丘陵或其他放牧區域中，通常由兒童或青少年的牧山羊人負責照顧，和較為廣為人知的牧羊人相似。這些放牧方法至今仍然為人所用。
mt: Domesticated goats are usually raised in hills or other grazing areas, usually taken care of by children or adolescents' goat herders, similar to the more well-known shepherds. These grazing methods are still used today.
ref: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: 英格蘭早在十六世紀就建造了馬拉軌道。
mt: England had built the Maraa orbit as early as the 16th century.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.

src: 雖然四輪貨運軌道僅由平行木板條組成，卻能讓馬匹在軌道上拖拉貨物，相較於當時稍微崎嶇的路面，運送速度更快且能裝載更多貨物。
mt: Although the four-wheel freight track is composed of parallel wooden boards, it can allow horses to pull cargo on the track, compared to slightly rugged roads at that time, the speed of transportation is faster and more cargo can be loaded.
ref: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.

src: 很早就開始採用軌枕將軌道固定住。但漸漸地，人們發現若鋪上鐵條，軌道效率較高。
mt: It was early on that the track was fixed with the use of a rail sleeper, but gradually people found that if you put iron bars on them, the track is more efficient.
ref: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.

src: 這成為常見作法，但鐵會使馬車的木輪上出現更多磨損。
mt: This becomes a common practice, but iron will cause more wear on the wooden wheels of carriages.
ref: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.

src: 最後，鐵輪取代了木輪。1767年，第一條全鐵的鐵道問世。
mt: Finally, the iron wheel replaced the wooden wheel. In 1767, the first full iron railway was introduced.
ref: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: 最早為人所知的運輸是走路，隨著 Homo Erectus（亦即直立人）的出現，人類在兩百萬年前開始直立行走。
mt: The earliest known transportation is walking, with the appearance of Homo Erectus (also known as Homo erectus), humans began walking upright two million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).

src: 他們的演化前輩南方古猿並不習慣直立行走。
mt: Their evolutionary predecessors, southern apes, were not accustomed to walking upright.
ref: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.

src: 在 420 至 390 萬年前的南方古猿化石中發現了雙足運動的特性，儘管查德人猿可能早在七百萬年前就已用雙足行走。
mt: Fossils of southern apes dating back to 4.2-3.9 million years ago have found the characteristics of bipedal movement, although the Chadian ape may have walked on its legs as early as seven million years ago.
ref: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: 我們可以開始過對環境更友善的生活，我們可以投身環保運動，甚至可以成為社運人士，以盡量減少未來的痛苦。
mt: We can start living a more environmentally friendly life. We can join the environmental movement and even become social activists to minimize future suffering.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.

src: 這在許多狀況下就跟「頭痛醫頭，腳痛醫腳」一樣。不過，如果我們想要的不止是暫時性的解決方案，那麼我們就應該找到問題的根源，然後徹底解決它們。
mt: This is the same as “headaches, feet and feet.” But if we want more than just a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problem and solve it completely.
ref: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.

src: 這世界因為人類科學與技術的進步而有了改變，而且由於人口過剩和人類浪費的生活方式，使得問題變本加厲，這點再明顯不過。
mt: The world has undergone changes due to the progress of human science and technology, and due to overpopulation and a way of life wasted by humans, problems have become increasingly severe, which is no more obvious.
ref: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: 在 7 月 4 日由國會通過後，一份經國會主席約翰·漢考克 (John Hancock) 和秘書長查爾斯·湯姆森 (Charles Thomson) 簽署的手寫草案被送到幾個街區外的約翰·當列普 (John Dunlap) 印刷坊。
mt: After being passed by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by Congress Chairman John Hancock and Secretary-General Charles Thomson was sent to the John Dunlap printing house a few blocks away.
ref: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.

src: 一整夜印出了 150 到 200 份，現稱「當列普單面印刷版」。
mt: A total of 150 to 200 prints were printed all night, now known as the single-sided printing plate of Dampton.
ref: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".

src: 該文件由約翰尼克森於 7 月 8 日在獨立廳的庭院內首次公開宣讀。
mt: The document was first publicly read by John Nixon on July 8 in the courtyard of the Independence Hall.
ref: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.

src: 其中一份在 7 月 6 日寄給喬治·華盛頓 (George Washington)，喬治·華盛頓於 7 月 9 日在紐約向他的部隊宣讀。一份副本在 8 月 10 日抵達倫敦。
mt: One of them was sent to George Washington on July 6, and George Washington read it out to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy arrived in London on August 10.
ref: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.

src: 人們所知的那 25 份仍存在的當列普單面印刷版是這份文件中留存下來最古老的版本，原始手稿並未留存下來。
mt: The 25 copies known to the public that still exist are the oldest surviving versions of this document, and the original manuscript has not survived.
ref: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.

src: 現今，許多古生物學家相信有一群恐龍存活至現代，也就是我們所稱的鳥類。
mt: Today, many paleontologists believe that a group of dinosaurs survived to the present day, which is what we call birds.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.

src: 因為牠們長著羽毛且能夠飛翔，很多人不認為牠們是恐龍的一種。
mt: Because they have feathers and can fly, many people do not think they are a type of dinosaur.
ref: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.

src: 但鳥類與恐龍仍有許多相似之處。
mt: But birds and dinosaurs still have many similarities.
ref: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.

src: 牠們的腳上有鱗片和爪子、會下蛋，而且會像暴龍一樣用兩隻後腳行走。
mt: They have scales and claws on their feet, lay eggs, and walk like Tyrannosaurus with two hind legs.
ref: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: 實際上，現在所有電腦都以操作二進位制編碼組成的訊息為基礎。
mt: In fact, all computers are now based on messages composed of binary coding.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.

src: 二進位數只能有 0 或 1 兩個值之一，這些數字被稱為二進位數位，或電腦術語所稱的位元。
mt: Binary numbers can only have one of two values, 0 or 1, which are called binary digits or the bit as a computer term.
ref: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: 體內中毒可能不會立即顯現。嘔吐之類症狀過於普遍，無法據之做出直接的診斷。
mt: Poisoning in the body may not immediately appear. Symptoms such as vomiting are too common to make a direct diagnosis based on it.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.

src: 最好判斷體內中毒的跡象，可能是發現有著已打開的藥物或毒性家用化學物的容器。
mt: It's best to determine the signs of poisoning inside the body, which may be found to have opened drugs or toxic household chemicals containers.
ref: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.

src: 檢視該特定毒物標籤上的急救說明。
mt: View the first aid instructions on that specific poison label.
ref: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: 「臭蟲」一詞，是昆蟲學家對這類昆蟲的正式稱呼。
mt: The term "sickworm" is a formal term used by entomologists to describe these insects.
ref: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.

src: 這個名稱來自於古代對於臭蟲的了解──牠們是高度適應以寄生於人體的昆蟲。
mt: This name comes from the ancient understanding of insects - they are highly adaptable insects that parasitize on human bodies.
ref: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.

src: 獵蝽和床蝨都有在巢內生長的特性，能適應在巢穴或其宿主的住宅中的生活。
mt: Hunting and bed bugs both have the property of growing inside nests, and can adapt to life in nests or their hosts' residences.
ref: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.

src: 在整個美國約有 400,000 起已知的多發性硬化症 (MS) 案例，使其成為較年輕和中年的成年人的主要神經性疾病。
mt: There are approximately 400,000 known multiple sclerosis (MS) cases across the United States, making it a major neurotic disease in younger and middle-aged adults.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.

src: 多發性硬化症是影響腦部、脊髓和視神經等中樞神經系統的病症。
mt: Multiple sclerosis is a condition affecting the central nervous system of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve.
ref: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.

src: 研究發現，女性罹患多發性硬化症的機率比男性高出兩倍。
mt: Research has found that women are twice as likely to develop multiple sclerosis than men.
ref: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: 夫妻可能會認定撫養寶寶不合乎他們或孩子的最大利益。
mt: The couple may determine that raising the baby is not in their best interests or the best interests of the child.
ref: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.

src: 這些伴侶可以選擇計畫領養他們的孩子。
mt: These partners can choose to adopt their children.
ref: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.

src: 收養係指親生父母終止其親權，讓另一對夫婦可以養育其子女。
mt: Adoption refers to the termination of parental rights by biological parents, allowing another couple to raise their children.
ref: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.

src: 科學的主要目標是透過科學方法了解世界運作的方式。這種方法實際上也引領著多數科學研究。
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works through scientific methods. This approach actually leads to most scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.

src: 但實驗法並不是唯一，實驗是能消除一個或多個假設的測試，問問題和進行觀察也能夠引領科學研究。
mt: However, experimental methods are not the only method; experiments can eliminate one or more hypotheses and ask questions and conduct observations can also lead to scientific research.
ref: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: 博物學家和哲學家專注於經典文本，尤其是拉丁文的聖經。
mt: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts, especially the Latin Bible.
ref: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.

src: 亞里斯多德的所有科學問題觀點，包含心理學在內，皆被接受。
mt: All of Aristotle's views on scientific issues, including psychology, were accepted.
ref: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.

src: 隨著希臘學問的沒落，西方世界斷開了其與希臘哲學和科學的根源。
mt: With the decline of Greek scholarship, the Western world severed its roots from Greek philosophy and science.
ref: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.

src: 許多學者觀察到的生理及行為上的節律，通常高度倚賴生物內生性的週期，及其隨生理時鐘所產生的物質。
mt: Many scholars have observed physiological and behavioral rhythms, which are usually highly dependent on biological endogenous cycles and the substances produced with physiological clocks.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.

src: 不僅是對於外在週期線索做出反應的週期節律，在細菌、真菌、植物與動物等大部分的生物身上都可觀察到。
mt: Not only is the periodic rhythm that responds to external periodic clues, but can be observed in most organisms such as bacteria, fungi, plants and animals.
ref: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.

src: 生理時鐘是自我維持的振盪器，即使沒有外部信號，也會持續自主運行的週期。
mt: The physiological clock is a self-sustaining oscillator, even without external signals, it will continue to run independently.
ref: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: 赫雪-蔡司實驗是顯示 DNA 為遺傳物質的主要實驗之一。
mt: The Hershey- ⁇  experiment is one of the main experiments to show that DNA is a genetic material.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.

src: 赫希 (Hershey) 與蔡斯 (Chase) 利用噬菌體，或稱病毒，將自己的 DNA 植入細菌中。
mt: Hershey and Chase use phages, also known as viruses, to implant their DNA into bacteria.
ref: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.

src: 他們進行了兩項實驗，一個是使用放射性磷標記噬菌體中的 DNA，另一個是使用放射性硫標記噬菌體的蛋白質。
mt: They conducted two experiments, one using radioactive phosphorus to mark DNA in phages and the other using radioactive sulfur to mark proteins in phages.
ref: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: 根據突變的種類、受影響遺傳物質的重要性、以及受影響細胞是否為生殖系細胞，突變能有各種不同的效果。
mt: Depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cells are reproductive cells, mutations can have various effects.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.

src: 只有生殖細胞系細胞中的突變會遺傳給子女，而其他地方的突變可以導致細胞死亡或癌症。
mt: Only mutations in the reproductive cell line cells are inherited to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: 以自然為主題的旅遊行程會吸引大自然有興趣的人參加，以享受自然景觀，包括野生動植物。
mt: A nature-themed tour will attract people interested in nature to participate, enjoying the natural scenery, including wild animals and plants.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.

src: 現場活動的例子包含打獵、釣魚、攝影、賞鳥，以及造訪公園與研習生態系統的相關資訊。
mt: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, and information related to visiting parks and learning ecosystems.
ref: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.

src: 例如到婆羅洲參訪、拍攝與瞭解紅毛猩猩。
mt: For example, visiting, taking photos and understanding of orangutans in Borneo.
ref: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: 每天早上，一批人開車離開鄉下小鎮前往工作地點，與另一批人擦身而過，他們的出發地正是另一批人的工作目的地。
mt: Every morning, a batch of people drive away from the rural town to their workplace, passing by with another batch of people, whose starting point is the work destination of another batch.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.

src: 在這種繁忙的交通往來中，每個人都與這個以私家車為基礎的交通系統有某種程度的連結，也支持了它的存在。
mt: In such busy traffic, everyone has some degree of connection with this private car-based transportation system and supports its existence.
ref: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.

src: 如今科學指出，這樣大規模的碳經濟活動，已讓生物圈脫離過去兩百萬年來支持著人類演進的穩定狀態。
mt: Today, science indicates that such large-scale carbon economic activities have allowed the biosphere to break away from a stable state of human evolution over the past two million years.
ref: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: 所有人都參與社會活動，使用運輸系統。幾乎每一個人都抱怨運輸系統。
mt: Everyone is involved in social activities, using the transportation system. Almost everyone complains about the transportation system.
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.

src: 在已開發國家，你極少會聽到類似有關水質和橋樑坍塌的抱怨。
mt: In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about water quality and bridge collapse.
ref: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.

src: 為什麼交通系統會招來這些怨言，為什麼每天都會出問題？是因為交通工程師能力不足？還是有更根本性的原因？
mt: Why are these complaints brought up by the traffic system? Why are there problems every day? Is it because the ability of traffic engineers is insufficient? Or is there a more fundamental reason?
ref: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: 交通流量就是研究兩地之間的個別駕駛和交通工具的移動情況，以及用路人之間的互動關係。
mt: Traffic flow is a study of individual driving and transportation movement between the two places, as well as the interaction between pedestrians.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.

src: 問題是，因為無法百分之百預測駕駛習慣，所以研究交通流量非常困難。
mt: The problem is that, because it can't predict driving habits 100%, research on traffic flow is very difficult.
ref: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.

src: 幸運的是，駕駛的行為趨向於合理的一致範圍裡，因此，車流趨向也有合理的一致性，並可用數學方式粗略地表現出來。
mt: Fortunately, the driver's behavior tends to be within a reasonable consistency range, so there is also a reasonable consistency in traffic flow and can be roughly expressed mathematically.
ref: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.

src: 為了更加完善地表示交通流量，我們定義了三種主要特徵之間的關係：(1) 流量，(2) 密度，與 (3) 速度。
mt: To better represent traffic flow, we have defined the relationships between three main characteristics: (1) flow rate, (2) density, and (3) speed.
ref: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.

src: 這些關係有助於交通設施的計畫、設計與運作。
mt: These relationships help with the planning, design and operation of transportation facilities.
ref: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: 昆蟲是最早在空中飛翔的動物。它們的飛行能力使它們能更輕易地躲開天敵，並更有效地找到食物和配偶。
mt: Insects are the earliest animals to fly in the air. Their flying ability makes them easier to avoid predators and find food and mates more efficiently.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.

src: 大部分的昆蟲都有把翅膀沿著身體摺疊起來之優勢。
mt: Most insects have the advantage of folding their wings along their bodies.
ref: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.

src: 這使牠們有更多可鑽入的小地方來躲避捕食者。
mt: This allows them to have more small places to penetrate to avoid predators.
ref: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.

src: 現今，無法收起翅膀的昆蟲只有蜻蜓與蜉蝣。
mt: Today, only dragonflies and slugs are insects that cannot retract their wings.
ref: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: 數千年前，一位名叫阿里斯塔克斯的人說太陽系是繞著太陽轉動的。
mt: Thousands of years ago, a man named Aristarchus said that the solar system was rotating around the sun.
ref: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.

src: 有些人覺得他是對的，但很多人持相反看法；他們認為包括太陽在內的太陽系（甚至其它星星）都是繞著地球移動的。
mt: Some people think he's right, but many people hold the opposite view; they think that the solar system (even other stars) including the sun) all move around the Earth.
ref: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).

src: 這似乎很合理，因為地球感覺起來並沒有在移動，不是嗎？
mt: That seems reasonable, because the Earth feels like it's not moving, right?
ref: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?

src: 亞馬遜河是地球上第二長、水量最大的一條河。它的水量是世界第二大河的八倍。
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river on Earth and has the largest volume of water. It has eight times the water volume of the world's second-largest river.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.

src: 亞馬遜河也是地球上最寬的河流，有些河段能達到六英里寬。
mt: The Amazon River is also the widest river on Earth, with some sections reaching six miles wide.
ref: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.

src: 地球上流入海洋的河水中，有整整 20％ 是來自於亞馬遜河。
mt: And 20 percent of all the rivers that flow into the ocean on Earth come from the Amazon River.
ref: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.

src: 亞馬遜河主流長 6,387 公里（3,980 英里），匯集了來自數千條小型河流的河水。
mt: The main stream of the Amazon River is 6,387 kilometers (3,980 miles) long, bringing together water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: 雖然石製金字塔的建造一直延續到古王國末期，但吉薩金字塔的施工規模和卓越技術無人可及。
mt: Although the construction of stone pyramids continued until the end of the ancient kingdom, the scale and excellent technology of the Giza Pyramid were unmatched.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.

src: 新王國時期的古埃及人對於他們祖先留下的歷史遺跡感到非常吃驚，當時這些遺跡已經超過千年之久了。
mt: The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom period were very surprised by the historical relics left behind by their ancestors, which had been over a thousand years.
ref: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: 梵蒂岡的人口為八百人左右，是全世界最小的獨立國家，也是人口最少的國家。
mt: The population of Vatican City is around 800 people, making it the smallest independent country in the world and also the country with the smallest population.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.

src: 梵蒂岡的法律和官方文書都使用義大利文。
mt: The Vatican's laws and official documents both use Italian.
ref: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.

src: 義大利語也是該國大部分工作人口平常使用的語言，拉丁語則多半在宗教儀式中使用。
mt: Italian is also a common language used by most of the country's working population, with Latin being used mostly in religious rituals.
ref: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.

src: 梵蒂岡的所有公民都是羅馬天主教徒。
mt: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: 人們自古就認識金、銀、銅等基本化學元素，因為這些元素皆以原貌存在於自然界，且使用原始工具開採相當簡單。
mt: People have known since ancient times the basic chemical elements of gold, silver, and copper, because these elements all exist in their original form in nature, and mining with primitive tools is quite simple.
ref: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.

src: 哲學家亞里斯多德立論，萬物皆由土、水、空氣及火等四要素中的一至多項所構成。
mt: Philosopher Aristotle's theory, all things are composed of one to more of the four elements of earth, water, air and fire.
ref: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.

src: 這更像是物質的 4 個狀態（以相同的順序排列）：固體、液體、氣體和等離子體，雖然他還推論它們會變成新的物質，來形成我們所看到的東西。
mt: This is more like the four states of a substance (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas and plasma, although he also inferred that they would become new materials to form what we see.
ref: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.

src: 合金基本上是兩種或以上的金屬的混合物。別忘了週期表上是有許多元素的。
mt: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don’t forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
ref: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.

src: 像鈣和鉀這樣的元素被視為金屬。當然，也有像銀和金這樣的金屬。
mt: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. And of course, there are metals like silver and gold.
ref: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.

src: 也能有含有少量非金屬元素（例如碳）的合金。
mt: It can also have alloys containing a small amount of non-metallic elements (such as carbon).
ref: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.

src: 宇宙中的所有事物皆由物質構成，而所有物質皆由稱為原子的微小粒子構成。
mt: All things in the universe are composed of matter, and all matter is composed of tiny particles called atoms.
ref: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.

src: 原子小得不可思議，小到數以兆計的原子足以塞進本句結尾的句點.
mt: Atoms are incredibly small, so small as trillions of atoms to fit into the end of this sentence.
ref: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.

src: 因此，鉛筆在剛問世時成為了許多人的好朋友。
mt: Therefore, pencils became good friends of many people when they first appeared.
ref: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.

src: 可惜，隨著新的書寫方式興起，鉛筆的地位和使用率逐漸衰退。
mt: Unfortunately, with the rise of new writing methods, the status and usage rate of pencils have gradually declined.
ref: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.

src: 大家現在都在電腦螢幕上寫訊息，再也用不到削鉛筆機了。
mt: Everyone is now writing on the computer screen, and there's no need for a pencil sharpener anymore.
ref: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.

src: 我們只能好奇，等到又有新發明出現，鍵盤又將何去何從。
mt: We can only be curious, and when there is a new invention, what will happen to the keyboard?
ref: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.

src: 核分裂炸彈的運作原理，是基於將眾多質子和中子融合成一個原子核需要大量能量。
mt: The operating principle of a nuclear fission bomb is based on the fact that it requires a large amount of energy to fuse numerous protons and neutrons into one atomic nucleus.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.

src: 有點像是推著沉重推車上山。再次分裂原子核會接著釋出一部份的該能量。
mt: It's a little bit like pushing a heavy cart up the mountain. Dividing the nucleus again releases some of that energy.
ref: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.

src: 有些原子的核心不穩定，這表示它們在沒有或很小推力的情形下也容易分裂。
mt: Some atoms' cores are unstable, indicating that they can easily split without or very little thrust.
ref: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: 月球表面是由岩石和塵土組成。月球的最外層稱為地殼。
mt: The surface of the Moon is composed of rock and dust. The outermost layer of the Moon is called the Earth's crust.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.

src: 地殼在近端厚約七十公里，在遠端厚約一百公里。
mt: The Earth's crust is about 70 kilometers thick at its proximal end, and about 100 kilometers thick at the remote end.
ref: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.

src: 它在月海下較薄，在高原下則較厚。
mt: It is thinner under the moon, and thicker on plateaus.
ref: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.

src: 或許在近端因地殼較薄而有更多月海。此處的岩漿較容易浮到表面。
mt: Perhaps there are more moons at the proximal end due to the thinness of the crust. The magma here is easier to surface.
ref: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: 內容理論的核心，是找出讓人心動或吸引他們的東西。
mt: The core of content theory is to find something that makes people feel or attracts them.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.

src: 這些理論認為人們有一些需求或渴望，在長大成人的過程中內化了。
mt: These theories believe that people have some needs or desires, which are internalized in the process of growing up to adulthood.
ref: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.

src: 這些理論探討是什麼讓某些人想要某些東西，以及在他們的環境中，是什麼讓他們想做或不做某些事。
mt: These theories explore what makes some people want something, and what makes them want to do or not do something in their environment.
ref: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.

src: 馬斯洛的需求層次理論和赫茲伯格的雙因子理論，是兩個熱門的內容理論。
mt: Maslow's hierarchy of needs and Herzberg's two-factor theory are two popular content theories.
ref: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: 一般來說，主管開始領導昔日的同儕時，有可能產生兩種行為。其中一種是試圖維持自己仍為同儕圈子裡的一員。
mt: Generally speaking, when a supervisor starts leading a former peer, there are two kinds of behavior that can occur. One is trying to maintain himself as a member of the peer community.
ref: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).

src: 這類經理人難以做出不受歡迎的決定、執行紀律處分、績效評估、指派責任範圍和讓下屬盡責。
mt: These types of managers find it difficult to make unpopular decisions, execute disciplinary measures, evaluate performance, assign responsibility scope and make subordinates responsible.
ref: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.

src: 而光譜的另一端，則會轉變為截然不同的人，他或她認為自己必須改變團隊一直以來的所有做法，並改用自己的方式行事。
mt: On the other end of the spectrum, it will transform into a completely different person; he or she believes that they must change all the team's actions and act in their own way.
ref: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.

src: 畢竟，領袖終究得對團隊的成敗負責。
mt: After all, the leaders have to take responsibility for the success or failure of the team.
ref: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.

src: 此行為時常會造就領導者與其他團隊成員間的分歧。
mt: This behavior often leads to differences between leaders and other team members.
ref: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.

src: 虛擬團隊必須遵守跟傳統團隊一樣的品質標準，但是有細微的差異。
mt: Virtual teams must follow the same quality standards as traditional teams, but with subtle differences.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.

src: 虛擬團隊成員通常都是直接配合的實體團隊的聯絡點。
mt: Virtual team members are usually direct-collocated physical teams' contact points.
ref: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.

src: 他們通常比傳統團隊成員擁有更多的自主權，因其團隊可能會配合不同的時區開會，他們的地方管理階層可能會無法理解這點。
mt: They usually have more autonomy than traditional team members, as their team may coordinate with different time zones for meetings, and their local management may not be able to understand this.
ref: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.

src: 具有名副其實的「隱形管理團隊」（摘自 Larson and LaFasto 1989 年的著作，第 109 頁） 也是個構成虛擬團隊的獨特要素。
mt: A well-known "invisible management team" (from Larson and LaFasto's 1989 work, page 109) is also a unique component of virtual teams.
ref: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.

src: 「隱形團隊」是一個管理團隊，每一名成員都直屬於此團隊，並由此團隊為每位成員設下標準。
mt: The “Invisible Team” is a management team, where each member is directly part of the team and the team sets standards for each member.
ref: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: 為什麼會有組織想要歷經耗時的流程建立學習機構？將組織的學習概念付諸實踐的其中一個目標，就是創新。
mt: Why would an organization want to go through a time-consuming process to establish a learning institution? One of the goals of putting an organization's learning concept into practice is innovation.
ref: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.

src: 當組織內各個功能式部門均有效利用所有可運用的資源時，便可發揮創造力和獨創力。
mt: When all functional departments within an organization effectively utilize all available resources, they can unleash creativity and originality.
ref: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.

src: 因此，組織合力克服障礙的過程能推動創新過程，以滿足客戶的需求。
mt: Therefore, the process of organizing and overcoming obstacles can drive innovation process to meet customer needs.
ref: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.

src: 在組織具備創新能力之前，領導人應打造創新文化、知識分享及組織學習。
mt: Before an organization has the ability to innovate, leaders should create a culture of innovation, knowledge sharing and organizational learning.
ref: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.

src: 安琪兒（2006年）說明了連續模式，這是一個用來幫助組織達到更高績效水準的方法。
mt: Angel (2006) explained the continuous model, a method used to help organizations reach higher performance levels.
ref: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.

src: 神經生物學資料為認知研究的理論方法提供具體證明，於是使研究範圍縮小並且更確切。
mt: Neurobiology data provides specific evidence for theoretical methods of cognitive research, thus reducing the scope of research and making it more precise.
ref: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.

src: 腦部病理學與行為之間的關聯支持科學家進行研究。
mt: The association between brain pathology and behavior supports scientists to conduct research.
ref: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.

src: 長久以來，人們始終知道不同類型的腦部受損、創傷、病變及腫瘤都會影響行為，並造成某些心理機能的改變。
mt: For a long time, people have always known that different types of brain damage, trauma, lesions and tumors will affect behavior and cause certain psychological function changes.
ref: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.

src: 新科技的發明，讓我們能夠觀察並研究前所未見的腦部結構和運作過程。
mt: The invention of new technologies allowed us to observe and study unprecedented brain structures and processes.
ref: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.

src: 這提供了我們許多建立模擬模型的資訊和素材，有助於瞭解我們心智運作的流程。
mt: This provides us with a lot of information and materials for building simulation models, which helps us understand the process of our mental operations.
ref: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.

src: 雖然人工智慧具有很強的科幻內涵，但人工智慧仍形成了電腦科學極重要的一個分支，專門處理機器的行為、學習和智慧型適應。
mt: Although artificial intelligence has a strong science fiction connotation, it still forms an extremely important branch of computer science, specializing in the behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation of machines.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.

src: 人工智慧研究的內容之一，是製造出可自動執行需以智慧行為完成任務的機器。
mt: One of the contents of artificial intelligence research is to create machines that can automatically execute tasks that need to be completed with intelligent behavior.
ref: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.

src: 範例包含控制、計畫與排程，回答顧客診斷與問題的能力，以及辨識手寫文字、聲音與人臉。
mt: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customers' diagnoses and questions, as well as recognizing handwritten text, sound, and faces.
ref: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.

src: 這些事情發展成為不同的學科，重點在於為現實生活的問題找到解決方式。
mt: These things have developed into different disciplines, focusing on finding solutions to real-life problems.
ref: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.

src: AI 系統現在常用於經濟、醫學、工程和軍事等領域，也內建於某些家用電腦和電動遊戲軟體中。
mt: AI systems are now commonly used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and military, and are also built into some home computers and video game software.
ref: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: 校外教學是學校教育重要的一環。很多時候，老師會想帶學生去公車到不了的地方。
mt: Outside school is an important part of school education. Many times, teachers want to take students to places where they can't get to the bus.
ref: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.

src: 科技提供虛擬校外教學做為解決方法。學生可以坐在教室裡參觀博物館藝術品、參訪水族館或欣賞美麗的藝術。
mt: Technology provides virtual off-campus teaching as a solution. Students can sit in the classroom to see museum artworks, visit aquariums or appreciate beautiful art.
ref: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.

src: 透過虛擬方式分享校外教學，也是回顧該次旅行和向未來班級分享經驗的好方法。
mt: Sharing external education through virtual means is also a good way to review the trip and share experiences with future classes.
ref: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.

src: 舉例來說，北卡羅萊納州班奈特學校的學生，每年都會為他們的北州首府參訪之旅設計一個網站，這個網站每年都會改版，但舊版本仍會保留在線上，當作剪貼簿來使。
mt: For example, students at the Bennet School in North Carolina would design a website every year for their visit to the capital of North Carolina, which would be revised annually, but the old version would still remain online as a scrapbook.
ref: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.

src: 部落格也有助於提高學生的寫作能力。雖然學生常以草率馬虎的文法和拼寫開始他們的部落格體驗，但因為有讀者的存在，所以一般可以改變這點。
mt: Blogs can also help improve students’ writing skills. While students often start their blogging experiences with sloppy grammar and spelling, they can generally change this because of the presence of readers.
ref: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.

src: 由於學生通常是最挑剔的讀者，因此部落客作者們會開始努力加強寫作以避免被批評。
mt: Because students are usually the most critical readers, bloggers will start to work hard to strengthen their writing in order to avoid being criticized.
ref: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.

src: 撰寫部落格也「迫使學生更加了解周遭的世界」。為了滿足觀眾的興趣，激發學生變得更加聰明有趣（Toto，2004 年）。
mt: Writing a blog also “forces students to understand more about the world around them.” To satisfy the interest of the audience, students become smarter and more interesting (Toto, 2004).
ref: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).

src: 寫部落格是一種啟發合作的工具，可以鼓勵學生將學習遠遠延伸到傳統的學校生活之外。
mt: Writing a blog is a tool that inspires collaboration, encouraging students to extend their learning far beyond traditional school life.
ref: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.

src: 正確使用部落格「可以增強學生分析與批判的能力；學生能透過積極回應網路教材，明確定義自己在他人撰寫的文章脈絡中處於何種位置，也能勾勒出自己對特定議題的觀點（奧拉維斯， 2002 ）。
mt: Proper use of blogs "can enhance students' ability to analyze and criticize; students can clearly define their position in the context of others' written articles through active response to online teaching materials, and also outline their views on specific issues (Olavus, 2002).
ref: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).

src: 渥太華是加拿大的首都，環境美麗宜人，使用英法兩種語言，擁有許多藝廊和博物館，展現加拿大的今昔風貌。
mt: Ottawa is the capital of Canada, with a beautiful and pleasant environment, using English, French, and many galleries and museums to showcase Canada's current and past.
ref: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.

src: 更南端是尼加拉瀑布，而北方則是馬斯科卡與其他地區，此處的自然美景仍未經開發利用。
mt: The southern end is Niagara Falls, while the northern part is Mascoca and other areas; the natural scenery here is still undeveloped.
ref: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.

src: 以上這些和其他種種，都讓安大略省被外地人視為典型的加拿大樣貌。
mt: These and other things have made Ontario a typical Canadian appearance for outsiders.
ref: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.

src: 更北方的大片地區人口稀少，有些幾乎是杳無人煙的荒野。
mt: The northern regions are sparsely populated, with some almost deserted wilderness.
ref: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.

src: 一個讓許多人感到驚訝的人口比較：居住在美國境內的非裔美國人，多於加拿大的公民人口。
mt: A population that surprised many people is a comparison of African Americans living within the United States, more than the Canadian citizen population.
ref: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.

src: 東非群島位於印度洋上的非洲東部沿岸。
mt: The East African Islands are located on the eastern coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.

src: 馬達加斯加是其中最大的一座島，野生動植物豐富，使該島本身自成一塊大陸。
mt: Madagascar is one of the largest islands, rich in wild animals and plants, making the island itself a continent.
ref: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.

src: 多數較小的島嶼皆為獨立國家，或與法國有著淵源，且以奢華海濱度假村聞名。
mt: Most of the smaller islands are independent countries, or have roots in France, and are famous for their luxurious seaside resorts.
ref: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.

src: 阿拉伯人也將伊斯蘭教帶到這片土地上，伊斯蘭教在葛摩和馬約特島獲得很大的發展。
mt: The Arabs also brought Islam to this land, and Islam developed greatly on the islands of Gammon and Mayot.
ref: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.

src: 歐洲影響力及殖民主義始於 15 世紀時，葡萄牙籍探險家瓦斯科·達伽馬發現自歐洲到印度的好望角航線。
mt: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, when Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered the Cape of Good Hope route from Europe to India.
ref: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: 北邊連接薩赫勒地區，南邊和西邊緊鄰大西洋。
mt: Connected to the Sahel region to the north, bordering the Atlantic Ocean to the south and west.
ref: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.

src: 女性：建議所有女性遊客，不論實際的婚姻狀況為何，都自稱已婚。
mt: Female: All female tourists are advised to call themselves married regardless of their actual marital status.
ref: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.

src: 戴上一個戒指也會有所幫助（但不要戴看起來太貴的。
mt: Wearing a ring can also help (but don't look too expensive).
ref: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.

src: 女性朋友也應該明白，文化差異可能會導致某些她們視為騷擾的情況，被人跟蹤、手臂被人抓住等狀況並不少見。
mt: Female friends should also understand that cultural differences may lead to certain situations they consider as harassment, such as being tracked and having their arms caught.
ref: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.

src: 拒絕男性時應表現堅定，不要害怕堅持立場（不管有沒有文化差異，這樣都是不對的！）
mt: When rejecting men, show firmness and don't be afraid to stand firm (no matter whether there are cultural differences, this is not right!)
ref: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).

src: 卡薩布蘭卡的現代城市由柏柏爾的漁民在西元前 10 世紀建立。腓尼基人、羅馬人和馬里尼德人曾將其作為戰略港口使用，稱為安法。
mt: The modern city of Casablanca was founded in the 10th century B.C. by the fishermen of Berber. The Phoenicians, the Romans and the Malinids used it as a strategic port, called Anfa.
ref: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.

src: 葡萄牙人將這座城市夷平重建，並命名為「Casa Branca」（白色房子），在 1755 年發生地震後又遺棄了這個地方。
mt: The Portuguese flattened and rebuilt the city, naming it "Casa Branca" (a white house), which was abandoned after an earthquake in 1755.
ref: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.

src: 摩洛哥蘇丹重建了這座城市，取名 「達魯 I 巴迪亞」。而「卡薩布蘭卡」則是在此建立貿易基地的西班牙貿易商為它取的名稱。
mt: The city was rebuilt by the Moroccan Sultan, who named it "Daru I Badia". The name "Casablanca" was given by a Spanish trader who established a trading base here.
ref: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.

src: 卡薩布蘭卡是全摩洛哥境內最無趣的購物處之一。
mt: Casablanca is one of the least interesting shopping places in Morocco.
ref: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.

src: 麥地那舊城一帶可輕易找到販售傳統摩洛哥商品的地方，包括塔吉鍋、陶器、皮製品、水煙及各式各樣的花俏飾品，但這些都是賣給遊客的。
mt: The area around Medina's Old Town can easily be found where traditional Moroccan goods are sold, including taki pots, pottery, leather goods, smoke and various other accessories, but these are all sold to tourists.
ref: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.

src: 戈馬是剛果民主共和國的一個觀光城市，位於最東邊，鄰近盧安達。
mt: Goma is a tourist city in the Democratic Republic of Congo, located on the easternmost edge, near Rwanda.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.

src: 2002 年，戈馬遭到尼拉貢戈火山的熔岩摧毀，該城市的大多數街道，尤其是市中心，均被掩埋。
mt: In 2002, Goma was destroyed by lava from the Niragungo volcano, burying most of the city’s streets, especially the city centre.
ref: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.

src: 雖然戈馬還算安全，但若要到戈馬以外地區旅遊，就必須做足功課，瞭解北基伍省持續的戰亂狀況。
mt: Although Goma is relatively safe, if you want to travel outside of Goma, you must do your homework to understand the ongoing war situation in North Kivu Province.
ref: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.

src: 該城市也是攀登尼拉貢戈火山的基地，可進行非洲一些最便宜的山地大猩猩追蹤活動。
mt: The city is also a base for climbing Mount Nilagongo, and can carry out some of Africa's cheapest mountain gorilla tracking activities.
ref: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.

src: 你可以使用 Boda-boda（摩托車計程車）遊覽戈馬，短程一般（當地）價格約 500 剛果法郎。
mt: You can use Boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to visit Goma, the short trip is generally (local) about 500 Congolese francs.
ref: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: 因為相比之下較難進入，因此「廷布克圖」逐漸成為遙遠異國的象徵。
mt: Because it was relatively difficult to enter, "Timbuktu" gradually became a symbol of distant foreign countries.
ref: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.

src: 現今的廷巴克圖是一座貧困的城鎮，但過往名聲讓其成為旅遊景點，且有一座機場。
mt: Today's Timbuktu is a poor town, but its past reputation has made it a tourist destination and there is an airport.
ref: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.

src: 1990 年，它因為沙漠沙塵的威脅而被列入瀕危世界遺產名單。
mt: In 1990, it was listed as a World Heritage in Danger list due to the threat of desert sand.
ref: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.

src: 這是亨利．路易斯．蓋茨的 PBS 特別節目《非洲世界奇觀》的主要停留地點之一。
mt: This is one of the main stops for Henry Louis Gates' PBS special "The Wonders of the African World".
ref: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.

src: 該城市與國內的其它城市有明顯差異，因為它偏向擁有阿拉伯而不是非洲風格。
mt: The city differs significantly from other domestic cities, as it tends to have an Arab rather than African style.
ref: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.

src: 克魯格國家公園 (KNP) 位於南非東北部，東接莫三比克，北鄰辛巴威，南邊以鱷魚河為界。
mt: Kruger National Park (KNP) is located in the northeastern part of South Africa, bordering Mozambique to the east, Zimbabwe to the north and the ⁇  River to the south.
ref: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.

src: 公園占地一萬九千平方公里，劃分為十四個生態區，棲息不同的野生動植物。
mt: The park covers an area of 19,000 square kilometers and is divided into fourteen ecological zones, inhabiting different wild animals and plants.
ref: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.

src: 它是南非的主要景點之一，也被視為南非國家公園 (SANParks) 的旗艦景點。
mt: It is one of South Africa's main attractions and is also considered a flagship attraction in the South African National Parks (SANParks).
ref: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).

src: 如同所有南非國家公園，這座公園設有日常保育及入場費。
mt: Like all South African National Parks, this park has daily conservation and admission fees.
ref: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.

src: 也許購買一張 Wild Card 聯票會比較划算，這種聯票可讓你進入南非某些精選的公園，或是南非所有的國家公園。
mt: Perhaps it’s a good idea to buy a Wild Card joint ticket that lets you enter some of South Africa’s best parks or all of South Africa’s national parks.
ref: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.

src: 香港島是香港特別行政區之名的由來，也是許多旅客的觀光重點。
mt: Hong Kong Island is the origin of the name of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, and it is also a major tourist destination for many tourists.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.

src: 有人說形成香港天際線的一整排建築物，在維多利亞港海水的襯托下，就像光輝閃亮的長條圖。
mt: Some people say that the whole row of buildings that form the Hong Kong skyline, under the sea water of Victoria Harbour, is like a gleaming long strip.
ref: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.

src: 若要欣賞香港最好的景色，你可以離開香港島並前往對岸的九龍海濱。
mt: To enjoy the best views of Hong Kong, you can leave Hong Kong Island and head to the Kowloon waterfront on the other side.
ref: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.

src: 香港島的都市發展絕大部份都集中在北部沿岸的海埔新生地上。
mt: Most of Hong Kong Island's urban development is concentrated in the northern coastal coastal areas of the newly developed coastal land.
ref: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.

src: 英國殖民者把這裡據為已有，因此如果想在這片土地上尋找殖民歷史的證據，這裡是個不錯的起點。
mt: British colonizers have taken this place as an existing one, so if you want to find evidence of colonial history on this land, this is a good starting point.
ref: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: 蘇達班是世界上最大的沿海紅樹林帶，從海岸綿延 80 公里（50 英里）直達孟加拉與印度內地。
mt: Sudaban is the world's largest coastal mangrove belt, stretching 80 kilometers (50 miles) from the coast to Bangladesh and the Indian mainland.
ref: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.

src: 巽達班斯森林已列入聯合國教科文組織世界遺產。位於印度境內的區域稱為巽達班斯國家公園。
mt: The Sundabans Forest has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The area within India is called the Sundabans National Park.
ref: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.

src: 這片森林不是只有紅樹林沼澤，也包含一部分曾遍及恆河平原、如今所剩無幾的巨大叢林。
mt: This forest is not only a mangrove swamp, but also contains part of the vast jungle that once covered the Ganges Plain and is now almost nothing.
ref: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.

src: 巽達班斯森林面積達 3,850 平方公里，其中約三分之一為水域或沼澤。
mt: The Sundabans Forest covers an area of 3,850 square kilometres, with about a third being water or marshland.
ref: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.

src: 蘇達班自 1966 年起即為野生動物保護區，目前該地區估計有 400 隻孟加拉虎，以及約 30,000 隻梅花鹿。
mt: Sudaban has been a wildlife sanctuary since 1966, with an estimated 400 Bengal tigers and approximately 30,000 sika deer in the area.
ref: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.

src: 巴士全天從區間巴士站（河的對岸）出發，但大多數的巴士會在 06:30 和 07:30 之間離站，尤其是那些前往東方和賈卡爾 / 布姆唐的巴士。
mt: Buses depart from the inter-city bus stop (along the river) throughout the day, but most buses leave between 06:30 and 07:30, especially those going to the East and Jakar/Bumthon.
