ref: Singapore is generally an extremely safe place to be and very easy to navigate, and you can buy almost anything after arriving.

src: 但由於地處赤道以北僅幾度之遙的「高熱帶地區」，您將需要同時應付（一向的）高溫和熾烈陽光（天空晴朗的情況下，這種情形比較少見）。
mt: However, due to its location just a few degrees north of the equator in the "high tropical region", you will need to cope with both (always) high temperature and intense sunlight (in the case of clear skies, this phenomenon is relatively rare).
ref: But being placed in the "high tropics" just a few degrees north of equator you will need to deal with both heat (always) and strong sun (when the sky is clear, more rarely).

src: 也有一些往北開往希伯崙的巴士，該地是亞伯拉罕、以撒、雅各等聖經中的先祖和他們的妻子所埋葬的傳統墓地所在。
mt: There are also some buses heading north to Hebron, which is the traditional burial ground of ancestors and their wives in the Bible such as Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, etc.
ref: There are also a few buses going north to Hebron, the traditional burial place of the Biblical patriarchs Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and their wives.

src: 確認您想搭的巴士會開到希布倫，而非只到基爾亞特‧阿爾巴鎮附近的猶太屯墾區。
mt: Make sure the bus you want to take will be driven to Hebron, not just to the Jewish settlement near Kilyat Alba town.
ref: Check that the bus you are thinking of taking goes into Hebron and not just to the nearby Jewish settlement of Kiryat Arba.

src: 內陸水道是非常理想的主題度假場所。
mt: Inland waterways are ideal theme getaways.
ref: Inland waterways can be a good theme to base a holiday around.

src: 例如參觀羅亞爾河谷及萊茵河谷的城堡，或乘船遊覽多瑙河耐人尋味的城市，或沿著伊利運河划船。
mt: For example, visit the castles of the Loire Valley and Rhine Valley, take a boat tour to the intriguing cities along the Danube River, or row along the Erie Canal.
ref: For example visiting castles in the Loire Valley, the Rhine valley or taking a cruise to interesting cites on the Danube or boating along the Erie Canal.

src: 水道也會形成一些熱門的健行和單車路線。
mt: Waterways also form some popular hiking and cycling routes.
ref: They also define routes for popular hiking and cycling trails.

src: 耶誕節是基督教最重要的節日之一，慶祝的是耶穌的誕生。
mt: Christmas is one of the most important Christian holidays, celebrating the birth of Jesus.
ref: Christmas is one of the most important holidays of Christianity, and is celebrated as the birthday of Jesus.

src: 許多基督教國家中的非信徒，及全球各地中不信仰基督教的人，也採納了這些節慶傳統。
mt: Many non-believers in Christian countries and those around the world who do not believe in Christianity have also adopted these holiday traditions.
ref: Many of the traditions surrounding the holiday have been adopted also by non-believers in Christian countries and non-Christians around the world.

src: 復活節有個傳統是在露天處醒著通霄不眠，並觀賞日出。
mt: Easter has a tradition of waking up in the open air to watch the sunrise.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise.

src: 當然有基督教神學對此傳統的解釋，但這很可能是基督教出現前就存在的春天及豐收儀式。
mt: Of course, there is an explanation of this tradition in Christian theology, but this may be a spring and harvest ritual that existed before the advent of Christianity.
ref: There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual.

src: 較傳統的教堂通常會在復活節週末的週六夜晚舉辦一場復活節守夜祈禱會，午夜到來時，參與的信眾會一齊慶祝耶穌的復活。
mt: Traditional churches usually hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday nights during Easter weekend, and when midnight arrives, the participating believers will celebrate Jesus' resurrection together.
ref: More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: 所有最初來到這個島嶼上的動物都是透過游泳、飛行或漂浮而到達的。
mt: All the animals that first arrived on this island were arriving through swimming, flying or floating.
ref: All animals that originally arrived in the islands came here either by swimming, flying or floating.

src: 由於與大陸距離遙遠，哺乳類動物無法橫渡過海，使得巨型陸龜成為加拉巴哥群島的主要食草動物。
mt: Due to its distance from the mainland, mammals were unable to cross the sea, making giant land turtles the main herbivores of the Galapagos Islands.
ref: Due to the long distance from the continent mammals were unable to make the journey making the giant tortoise the primary grazing animal in the Galapagos.

src: 自從人類登陸加拉巴哥群島後，包括羊、馬、牛、老鼠、貓和狗等許多哺乳動物都被引進到島上。
mt: Since humans landed on the Galapagos Islands, many mammals including sheep, horses, cows, mice, cats and dogs have been introduced to the island.
ref: Since the arrival of man to the Galapagos, many mammals have been introduced including goats, horses, cows, rats, cats and dogs.

src: 如果你在冬季造訪北極或南極地區，你會經歷永夜，亦即太陽不會升到地平線以上。
mt: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic region during winter, you will experience eternal night, that is, the sun will not rise above the horizon.
ref: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon.

src: 因為天空幾乎整天都是黑的，提供了觀賞北極光的絕佳機會。
mt: Because the sky is almost all day black, it provides an excellent opportunity to watch the Northern Lights.
ref: This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock.

src: 由於這些地區人口稀少，因此通常沒有光害的問題，您也可以欣賞到星星。
mt: Because these areas are sparsely populated, there is usually no light pollution problem, and you can also enjoy the stars.
ref: As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.

src: 日本的工作文化比起西方人所習慣的更為階級化且正式。
mt: Japanese work culture is more class-oriented and formal than Westerners' habits.
ref: Japanese work culture is more hierarchical and formal that what Westerners may be used to.

src: 西裝是標準的商務服裝，同事之間會以姓氏或職稱來稱呼彼此。
mt: A suit is a standard business garment, and colleagues will call each other by surname or title.
ref: Suits are standard business attire, and coworkers call each other by their family names or by job titles.

src: 工作場所的和諧是非常重要的，要強調團隊合作，而非頌揚個人成就。
mt: Workplace harmony is very important, emphasizing teamwork rather than individual achievement.
ref: Workplace harmony is crucial, emphasizing group effort rather than praising individual accomplishments.

src: 員工所做的決定多半都必須通過上級批准，而且必須服從上級指示，不能有異議。
mt: Most of the decisions made by employees must be approved by their superiors, and they must obey their superiors' instructions, without any objection.
ref: Workers must often get their superiors' approval for any decisions they make, and are expected to obey their superiors' instructions without question.
